For those moments when your players have taken the inevitable path away from whatever you have planned, the Consult Appendix Z series provides the ideal tool for conjuring up a quick random solution to get you through to the end of the session or your next flash of inspiration. In 20 locked-and-loaded pages, the Another Bug Hunt supplement provides myriad options for the random creation of horrific biological weapons and insatiable xenoforms. Distant colonies and remote waystations fall silent as something writhes out of the darkness and consumes the flame of humanity. You can either roll randomly with a 6-sided die or flick to a random page and choose a numbered section, then inflict the content on your appreciative players.

Consult Appendix Z - #2: Another Bug Hunt is a system-free supplement and you can easily adapt it to your favourite game system or campaign setting.

170602.name: World Wide Wrestling (Patreon Release)
170602.description:
Author Summary

World Wide Wrestling is a tabletop pen-and-paper role-playing game that enables you to create your own professional wrestling franchise. You and your friends create iconic wrestling characters, throw them together into feuds and storylines, play out the in-ring action at the table and go behind the scenes to explore the relationships and power struggles that drive the kayfabe decisions made "on screen".

Additional information
WWW was first released by the author on Patreon and later as a full-scale Kickstarter, with gimmicks like a print-and-play ring and posters.

170603.name: Adventurer and Troll (revised)
170603.description:
Author introduction
TWO PLAYERS - ONE TROLL ONE ADVENTURER.
THIS IS ABOUT NEGOTIATION AND GETTING TO YES
OR MAYBE BEING EATEN BY A TROLL.
INTRODUCE SMALL IDEAS. MAKE SMALL IDEAS BIG
TELL A STORY TOGETHER. BOTH BE REAL.

This version updated the core mechanic. It also added a plain-English explanation of gameplay, a writeup about the intention of the game and different ways to play.

170604.description:
At the dawn of the SMC age, the people were losing faith in an increasingly amoral society. Mother was developed to emulate human thought and emotion, to simulate human desires and aspirations, to better understand the rapid decline in morality. The citizens of Sapporo became the guinea-pigs for this technological experiment. A series of city-wide neural implant programs, dubbed “the harvests”, enabled the gathering of data directly from a person’s cerebral cortex.

Mother’s neural net became more and more empowered by the collective thoughts of a city of souls. She soon became her own master, not just reading the minds of her citizens, but controlling them. Mother was in charge and the people were now her automatons.

Only a few, the few who from fear, mistrust or in protest, avoided the harvests and remained untouched by Mother’s influence. Like sewer rats they hide in an underground complex in Sapporo's Susukino district. While society at large became free from crime, free from poverty, free from emotion, without free-will or faith, from these few there came the criminals, the bootleggers, and the self-serving; the hungry, the frightened and the “Renegades”.

Renegade is an abstract-euro thematic deck-building game for 1 to 4 players. You are a new breed of Decker - a Renegade. You will hack into a network of five servers, operated by one of four Super-Massive-Computers (SMCs). Each of these four SMCs have their own AI and increasing complexity to defeat. You must survive a series of Countermeasure events before the network becomes overrun by Sparks and Guardians. Once you are jacked into an SMC’s servers, with a profile bringing its own special ability, you will move across its partitions and fight to take control of the network by using informational, destructive, deceptive and cognitive attacks.

Your Decker can seek upgrades (tools, software, apparel and information) by visiting the local bar, the "Electric Sheep". Once a fashionable hang-out for attractive young lovers seeking a voyeur's view of the city, it has now gone underground. An intimidating bar full of hit men and debt collectors, fixers and dealers, trading contraband from all across Sapporo, it's not the sort of place to take a date. This is where you will trade for new command cards, enhancing your Command Deck to become a more skillful Renegade.
170604.name: Renegade
boardgamepodcastepisode: Gaming Rules! – Podcast 11

170605.name: Scions of Dusk
170605.description:
From publisher blurb:

With an emphasis on darkness and the planes of shadow, Scions of Dusk is a compendium of options for players and DMs, compatible with the 5th edition of Dungeons & Dragons.

Inside you will find:

Changeling, the offspring of dark fey raised by humans.
Shadowborn, descendants of humans with a shard of shadow essence in their soul.
Oath of Sin, a new oath for paladins who become heralds of vices and passions.
The Vampire, a new and bloodthirsty patron for the warlock class, complete with two eldritch invocations for vampiric warlocks.
Dark Ones, devious dwellers of shadow.
Three new magic items.

170606.name: AEROSTAR
170606.description:
Do you have what it takes to build an airline empire? Find out with AEROSTAR.

This fun filled game will keep you coming back for more. AEROSTAR is an easy to learn yet dynamic game. Do you have what it takes to hire, invest, and build the best airline? If so you will be crowned the next AEROSTAR. Let the bidding begin!!!

Players start a round of play by bidding to hire an executive for their airline. All Executives are not made equal so choose accordingly. Then each player has an opportunity to invest in airline tech stocks, fuel stocks, or several other money making opportunities. This segment is also bidding based so budget wisely or your opponents might outbid you and steal your investment opportunity.

Next Players buy their Airplane Fleets. This segment is Auction/Bidding based also. There are 4 airline tech companies providing 30 different fleet types, all with different money making abilities and fuel efficiencies. After this, Players must buy fleet fuel from the market in order for their fleets to operate. This market price is constantly changing so be careful when building your airline fleet or you might lose money.

Players then have the opportunity to buy Terminals in Major and Minor Cities in a start to creating their Airline Empire. By creating connections players earn money if their fleet can fulfill the connections and have the fuel to do so. Each round ends with connection and investment profits being paid.

A yearly market card is drawn that effects the next rounds game play. In AEROSTAR there are market fuel increases, Union Strikes, and many more global impacts. You never know what might happen in the adventure of becoming the next AEROSTAR.

170607.name: Gene Wars
170607.description:
From the creators of Populous, an unusual RTS game based on the premise of bio-engineering your units. In the game you control four different people (Engineer, Ranger, Botanist and Geneticist) to "bio-genetically crossbreed 5 types of creatures" with the goal of restoring 30 planets.

"Crossbreed Your Way to Universal Supremacy"

Source: Box, CD-ROM, manual.

170608.description:
People-Person! is a game about life. You've got a life, don't you? Then, you'll like this game!

Gameplay is based upon 50% strategy and 50% luck of the cards.

The PEOPLE cards represent your friends and family.
The EVENTS cards represent the good, bad and sometimes ugly things that can (and probably will) happen to you in your lifetime.

Players score points by declaring a "BEST" FRIEND during their turn (with their PEOPLE cards), playing GAIN cards on themselves during their turn, and trumping LOSE cards with their friends when not their turn. Trumping can be done with anywhere between 1-5 friends, so long as each friend is essential to the trump. Scoring is based upon the number of friends used in the trump. (Example, 1-friend trump, gain attributes of 1 friend. 3-friend trump, gain attributes of all 3 friends MINUS the attributes of the LOSE card. 5-friend trump, automatically win the game, but is very rare.)

Players also have a FAMILY in which they score points at the beginning of the game and then periodically, depending on the number of FAMILY REUNION cards (a type of GAIN card) played. (the narrative of this game perfectly captures the absurdities and truths of life)

BONUS cards (a type of EVENTS card) help shake-up, speed-up and frustrate gameplay.

The first person to score 10 points in all 7 attributes:
AUTHENTICITY, CHARISMA, COMFORT, CONFIDENCE, KNOWLEDGE, RESPECT and SECURITY becomes the ultimate People-Person! and wins the game.

Whether manipulative or wholesome, strategic or just-plain-lucky, People-Person! perfectly captures the relationships that bind us all!
170608.name: People-Person!

170609.description:
Treatment is a game for 2-5 players about psychiatric treatment. The goal of the game is to win four cases.

Each case represents a psychiatric disease such as depression or Obsessive Compulsive Disorder. A case is played through a number of rounds where the players can either choose to manage their hands or secretly treat the case by playing treatments from different categories.

But watch out if a symptom that matches the category of the case is drawn the rounds end and treatment starts. In order to win you need to take care of the cases you already have in treatment as well as providing the best treatment for the presented case.
170609.name: Treatment: A Psychiatry Card Game

170612.description: The Jade Guardian Elite Set introduces the Jade Thornbeast, Jade Phalanx, Jade Harpy, and Jade Dervish. Each figure also includes an exclusive Knight.
170612.name: Golem Arcana: Jade Guardian Elite Set

170613.description: The Rangers of the Oath Elite Set introduces the Sworn Creeper, Sworn Woodguard, Sworn Collector, and Sworn Woodguard. Each figures includes an exclusive Knight.
170613.name: Golem Arcana: Rangers of the Oath Elite Set

boardgamepublisher: 植民地戦争+α (Shokuminchi Sensou Plus Alpha)
170614.description:
This is a two-player game about building a farming village in rural Vietnam. The board comes in two double-sided halves that can be fit together to form four different configurations. The assembled board displays a 6x6 grid, with each row and column marked by the face of a die. Six of the squares on the board (those with identical row and column numbers) are action spaces.

Players purchase tiles that represent resources, such as food or animals, or buildings. These tiles are then placed on the game grid. On each turn, the active player takes one die chosen from among the dice rolled by the opponent, then rolls three remaining dice and may select one of those three. The player then resolves any actions or income produced from tiles on the board where the rows and columns corresponding to the two dice intersect. Any income may be used to purchase more tiles to be placed on the board.

The players are striving to reach five specific goals. The first person to reach three more goals than the opponent (3 vs. 0 or 4 vs. 1) is the winner. If no one leads by three, the game ends when all 30 non-action squares on the game grid are filled, and the player who has obtained the most goals at that point is the winner.
170614.name: Mura Korogashi

170615.name: Lineo Duel
170615.description:
User Summary

Who will you challenge to a Lineo Duel, the brand new board game that combines simplicity and strategy.

170616.name: Air Traffic Madness
170616.description: Air Traffic Madness is a game for 2 to 5 people where players compete to land as many planes as possible. Each plane will score a variable number of victory points plus bonuses depending on how challenging a runway you land it on. Each player secretly chooses three orders cards to issue to their planes, two direct orders and one general order. Then players take turns revealing their orders and moving their planes. The player who lands the planes that are worth the most VPs wins. Beware, there are events that occur every other round plus bonus cards that players can earn which will change the course of the game. Each player also has a few planes worth zero VPs which could be damaging to you if they crash into your high valued planes. Can you navigated the hectic air space and be crowned the king of the air traffic control? Are you ready for Air Traffic Madness?

170618.name: Okashinobi
boardgamepublisher: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)
170618.description:
オカシノビ is a game modeling the epic struggle between the ninjas of the Mushroom and Bamboo Shoot factions. It employs hidden team affiliations, asymmetric player powers and inter-player combat using a rock-paper-scissors resolution. In addition to the Mushrooms and Bamboo Shoots, each game also incorporates a set of neutral factions: so the agendas of each player are never clear.

Players manage a hand of six cards: all different; each with a faction symbol (Mushroom, Bamboo Shoot or Neutral) in addition to the image of a rock, paper or scissors hand gesture. In a player's turn she may:

Pass a card from hand secretly to another player to inquire as to their faction loyalties. For the most part, a player responds "yes" if their affiliation matches the card, and "no" otherwise. Some player affiliations require a false response to any query!
Attack another player. Both players select a card from hand, then reveal together. If tied, another card is played. Cards played are unavailable for re-use until all six cards have been played: at that point all are reclaimed.
Reclaim one played card to her hand.




The various player powers affect the actions: some are strong one-shot powers; others more modest powers that always apply.

The game continues until one faction has achieved their victory.

170620.name: Running Rampant (Issue 3 - Autumn 1990)
170620.description: Lion Rampant newsletter. In the editorial, it is explained that "Lion Rampant" just merged with "White Wolf Publishing" to become "White Wolf". The newsletter was mailed out with a complimentary issue of White Wolf magazine as "Christmas gift", as well as a personal note from Stewart Wieck and a White Wolf product catalog.

170621.name: D6xD6 Role-Playing Game (Kickstarter Core Edition)
170621.description:
From the Introduction:

These D6×D6 role-playing game rules are designed with three purposes in mind:

To create distinctive characters quickly;
To provide fun, simple dice mechanics that cover a wide range of skills and action situations―including, if you like, combat using miniature figures;
To serve as the backbone for countless adventure settings, from high fantasy to gritty modern to other, quirky worlds.




As the author of these rules, I've had considerable professional experience in game publishing. I've also long been a fan of what was once considered "small press" but has since evolved into print-on-demand (POD) publishing. These D6×D6 rules draw equally on my professional experience and love of innovation.
Welcome to the many worlds of the D6×D6 role-playing game!

170622.name: Wallet Warriors Wilderness
170622.description:
They’re brave, adventurous & ready to explore!
Step out of the dungeon and into the light of the endless wilderness! Face deadly new monsters, defeat insidious new traps and discover incredible new treasures! This expansion set for Wallet Warriors gives you new encounter charts, new scenarios and a new challenge: random Events! Plus, with 24 new map cards to explore, the adventure can go on forever. More markers, figures and dice make the set a must have for die-hard adventurers! So get ready to brave the mountains, swamps, oceans and forests of the Wallet Warriors Wilderness!

With a simple roll of the die your adventurers (such as thief, druid or elf) move through the randomly created wilderness and discover either a monster, trap or treasure! If your level and roll is high enough, or if your abilities are good enough, you can beat the adversaries and continue on to succeed in your quest of finding gold, rescuing the princess or just exploring the entire map!

170623.name: Odysseus: Winds of Fate
170623.description: Odysseus took an epic voyage from Troy to Ithaca. You play as the Fates, who observe Odysseus on his voyage... Not entirely interested in whether he makes it home safe or not, you will bet on the outcome of Odysseus' journey and each of his adventures, and then use your influence with the gods to make sure your bets pay off.

170624.name: Crusaders: Thy Will Be Done
170624.description:
Move your knights, erect buildings, and go crusading to spread the influence of your Order.

When the Orders get too strong, King Philip will become nervous and disband all Templar orders, ending the game.

Crusaders uses a combination of the popular Rondel and Mancala mechanisms. Each player has their own rondel, which they can upgrade over the course of the game, that controls their action choices during the game. Your faction gives you a special power to control your rondel, and the buildings you erect will help you form a strategy.

170625.name: Squares
170625.description:
To achieve victory on this board of squares, you must overwhelm the center! The object of the game is to locate three of your own tiles in the centre row on a 5x5 grid.

Players take turns to do one of: place a tile, move a tile, or use a tile's special power. The total value of tiles permitted in any row is 8, constraining both players. Tiles are double-sided, and you are not permitted to examine the back of an opponent's tile before a special power flips it.

boardgameimplementation: Darkest December: Battle of the Bulge 1944
170627.description:
Small-unit tactical treatment of the battles in and around Hotton, Melines and Quatre Bras during The Battle of the Bulge, using the Advanced Tobruk System rules.
These battles can be re-enacted in twenty all-new scenarios for Advanced Tobruk System, partnered up with four all-new cardstock maps with winter terrain, AFV cards and the usual Battlefield Walkaround with historical notes and all the special rules for this module. Additionally, 2½ sheets of combat unit counters are included, representing the German and American soldiers and weapons in play during this crucial struggle.

Requires ATS Rules, playaids, and standard ATS markers, sold separately.
170627.name: ATS Core Module: Bulge – The Battle of the Bulge at Hotton/Melines/Quatre-Bras Crossroads

170628.name: Flags of Valour: Pacific Campaign
170628.description:
Flags of Valour is a toolkit system for war game enhancement. This particular release is Set 2, and deals with the Japanese and American forces of the Pacific.

FOV is a set of modules that extend the use of any counter based war game so that you can add both the often under-utilized practice of “Fog of War” OR that of higher level Intelligence Gathering and Logistics to virtually any simulation game. The game tool is also used to represent hidden assets such as Ammunition Supply, Fuel, and other factors common to any higher level logistic advantages gained via logistical planning. It is in fact this "Level Over" that FOV uses to bring new strategies and tactics to most war games without changing the underlying game rules. The level of added realism this tool set provides is rarely found in conjunction with any other current game publication.

What the Flags of Valour systems all do is give players of wargames a way to remove most of your counters from the board at the start of any game, and replace them with national hidden placement counters. Meantime you have a hidden area where normal game counters are kept on LUC (Logistical Unit Cards) until enemy recon or proximity force the regular unit pieces to be placed on the board and revealed. This allows war games to start with a form of hidden movement and place that is traditionally thought of as “double blind” play. Except in this case you can do the double-blind with only one central board (unlike the awkward and messy way that most double blind games take up a lot of room and require two copies of a board or a game).

Depending on the particular FOV release, some provide for additional hidden rules such as Strongpoints, Air Strikes, Guerrilla activity, Supply Lines, and more. Add on rules are completely optional, and are left to the discretionary use of the players using the system.

Each FOV release comes with 2-6 nation state counters. There are releases for many different eras available, but primarily the counter sets cover WW2 and Modern use. There are also the “125” series of FOV releases for use with Miniatures games. Those use larger placement counters and much larger LUC (Logistical Unit Cards) on which to place miniatures hidden off the board.

170629.name: Flags of Valour: Blitzkrieg
170629.description:
Flags of Valour is a toolkit system for war game enhancement. This particular release is Set 3, and deals with counters for the units of the Blitzkrieg years - namely France, Belgium, Netherlands, Poland and Norway.

FOV is a set of modules that extend the use of any counter based war game so that you can add both the often under-utilized practice of “Fog of War” OR that of higher level Intelligence Gathering and Logistics to virtually any simulation game. The game tool is also is used to represent hidden assets such as Ammunition Supply, Fuel, and other factors common to any Operational level command of your troops on a typical battlefield. It is in fact this Operational over-level that FOV uses to bring new strategies and tactics to most war games. The level of added realism this tool set provides is rarely found in conjunction with any other current game publication.

What the Flags of Valour systems all do is give players of wargames a way to remove most of your counters from the board at the start of any game, and replace them with national hidden placement counters. Meantime you have a hidden area where normal game counters are kept on LUC (Logistical Unit Cards) until enemy recon or proximity force the regular unit pieces to be placed on the board and revealed. This allows war games to start with a form of hidden movement and place that is traditionally thought of as “double blind” play. Except in this case you can do the double-blind with only one central board (unlike the awkward and messy way that most double blind games take up a lot of room and require two copies of a board or a game).

Depending on the particular FOV release, some provide for additional hidden rules such as Strongpoints, Air Strikes, Guerilla activity, Supply Lines, and more. Add on rules are completely optional, and are left to the discretionary use of the players using the system.

Each FOV release comes with 2-6 nation state counters. There are releases for many different eras available, but primarily the counter sets cover WW2 and Modern use. There are also the “125” series of FOV releases for use with Miniatures games. Those use larger placement counters and much larger LUC (Logistical Unit Cards) on which to place miniatures hidden off the board.

170630.name: Axiom Verge
videogamehonor: 2014 Game Critics Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Global Game Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Indie Video Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best PS Vita Game Nominee
2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Gameplay of the Year Nominee
2015 The Game Awards Best Independent Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Honorable Mention
170630.description:
User Summary

Axiom Verge is a 2D retro-style metroidvania action/exploration game created by one single person: Thomas Happ. The player takes on the role of Trace, a man suffering from a fatal injury who gets teleported into a strange dimension where he needs to defeat a being called Apotheos who threatens the galaxy.

Heavily inspired by Metroid and Castlevania, Axiom Verge consists of exploring around the big complex, collecting various powerups and special abilities that gradually enables the player to reach further and further areas.

Personal credits:
Program, design: Thomas Happ

170631.name: Rotten Railway!
170631.description:
A simple roll-and-move game from the British magazine Horrible Histories #23.

The board consists of a track with 33 spaces. On your turn you roll one six-sided die and move your pawn that many spaces. If you land on an event space, you simply follow the instructions.

The first player to reach the finish wins.

170632.name: Game of Legions
170632.description:
User Summary

This is a match-3 game where you command an army. Match the symbols (axes, swords, spears, archers, mages, healers) to unleash an attack on the enemy forces. Earn gold in order to upgrade your army. Each level contains three achievements (win in X moves, do X combos) with a reward of extra gold.

170633.name: Shaintar/Suzerain Crossover: Godstrike Tempest
170633.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Storm Like No Other. Tread Softly. Fight Hard.

Sebaya, the InfernoOg’M Drakar is the Eye of the Dragon, a lake in the Northern Gathers. In the middle of the lake lies an island, an island where few venture. In the middle of the island lies Castle WinterHawk, built by a pre-Kal empire but long abandoned.

This is where a portal to a hungry god has opened. This is where the Godstrike Tempest will strike, and it strikes today.

Godstrike Tempest is high level Savage Worlds adventure for Shaintar characters of at least Heroic Rank, and/or Suzerain characters.

It's a grand crossover event showing the exceptional potential of the Suzerain Continuum.

It's an epic showdown pitting larger-than-life heroes against demon lords and chaotic godlings for the fate of an entire reality.

This product also contains the Storm Druid Edge, for those looking a bit of flash and bang for their druid characters.

170634.name: Rock & Rule: The Spellbook of Gristlegrim's Dwarves
170634.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a gamemaster supplement intended for Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls (although it will work with any version of the rules). Ken St Andre has decided that each of the kindred (Dwarves, Elves, Fairies, Trolls, etc) should have its own spell book, and this is the first of them. Dwarven wizards are rare, but when you find one these are the spells he's very likely to know. Dwarven magic is just a little HARDER than human magic.

170635.name: False Promises
170635.description:
From publisher blurb:

For two weeks, shipments of ore and gold from Principal Mine 127 have not arrived in Bordovia. All messengers sent to the mine to investigate, including Sivonan soldiers, have not returned. Baron Ungur Wyrmbul demands to know what has happened to his top producing mine. He cannot send any more troops to investigate the mine and nearby town of Kwaltist, with his border forts near Darkhome already insufficiently supported. Who will investigate the missing shipments and solve the mystery at Kwaltist?

False Promises is an adventure for 3-5 players, with characters level 1-3. It's playable with the classic d20 game systems of the 1980s.

170636.name: Holy Vindicator
170636.description:
From publisher blurb:

Many faiths have within their membership an order of the church militant, be they holy knights or dark warriors, who put their lives and immortal souls on the line for their faith. They are paragons of battle, eschewing sermons for steel. These men and women are living conduits of divine power, down to their very blood, which they happily shed in a moment if it brings greater glory to their deity or judgment upon heretics, infidels, and enemies of the faith.

Prestige Class: Holy Vindicator

Role: The holy vindicator has substantial combat skills and her channeling powers are prodigious. Those whose religious views align well with the vindicator will find a ready ally.

170637.name: The Last Parsec: Leviathan
170637.description:
From publisher blurb:

The jungle planet Leviathan teems with mammoth lacerauns, savage beasts of enormous size and cunning, potential trophies unmatched in any other star system. Intentionally undeveloped beyond a few tourist-oriented settlements, Leviathan nonetheless draws more than just adventure-seeking hunters, including researchers and those who would see the world left completely untouched. Both are more than willing to turn the tables on any would-be hunters.

Leviathan is a setting book for The Last Parsec. It contains new locations and characters for the planetary system, new Setting Rules for Leviathan’s natural dangers, a Plot Point Campaign, Savage Tales, and a host of new creatures–especially the lacerauns.

170638.name: The Rangers of Uteria
170638.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Spell-less Ranger

Uteria is a world with very little magic. To some, what a Ranger can do seems like magic, but to the ranger it is just a natural ability or skill.

This guide gives Rangers Natural Talents, a replacement for spells, which emulates many of the base spells they receive after level 4 and uses the Uteria Mana System for gameplay.

This guide is to help players design and play their Rangers within the World of Uteria.

170639.name: Emperor Penguin
170639.description:
From publisher blurb:

EMPEROR PENGUIN!!

Once a prominent scientist and villain during WWII, an accident transferred Mister Mastermind's mind into a penguin's body! Bestowed with amazing psionic powers after his transformation, he's no longer the villain he once was. Now, he's Emperor Penguin!

170640.name: Boxing Gym
170640.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 40 x 20 inch Battlemap of a Boxing Gym, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play and a 360 view of the map.

“It ain’t much of a choice. I break your legs and cripple you for life or you let our best fighter smash your face when you throw the fight tonight. Don’t know about you, but I’d rather keep walking than worry about my good looks.”

Do you dare enter the boxing ring where fighters have shed sweat, blood, and tears upon victory or defeat? As you enter the gym, the pungent aroma of sweat assails your nose. The floorboards are old and creak as you walk on them. You swear that some of the floorboards in the back have been taken out in odd two by four shapes…

Boxing Gym is an interior map of a four-corner boxing ring, surrounding gym, and a small office. Boxing Gym includes a 360-degree panoramic view from the center of the room right next to the boxing ring.

Boxing Gym is intended for use in modern games. Its gritty, grimy, and bloody atmosphere also fits pulp and horror games.

Boxing Gym has a lot of scope. Besides a boxing ring, the four corner ring can be used for a martial artist fighting ring, or a four-corner wrestling ring.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Broken Legs or Jaw, Your Choice: One of the Player Character’s enemies, debts, or favors comes into play. A criminal organization is running a fight club at night. The criminal organization captures the Player Character and tells them to either fight in the club tonight or they break his legs. If the Player Character agrees, the criminal organization tells them to make it look good and throw the fight. This might cause a complication for some characters that are arrogant, overconfident, have a code of honor, etc. where doing anything less than their best conflicts with their personality and ethics.

Meanwhile, the rest of the group is searching the streets for their friend. Eventually they find the boxing gym at night where their friend is in the ring and fighting a large, musclebound opponent.

The question becomes does the Player Character throw the fight? If so the criminal organization is happy and forgives debts or favors as well as improves its attitude towards the character (such as becoming unfriendly or neutral rather than a hostile enemy).

If the Player Character doesn’t throw the fight, the criminal organization isn’t happy after losing money and tries to kill the Player Character as payment for its loss of cash. It’s up to his friends to help get him out of the fight club alive.

170641.name: gadZOOks!
170641.description:
gadZOOks! is a whimsical card game about managing a zoo and breeding adorable baby animals. Players must wisely use their limited resources to bid on new animals and outmaneuver their opponents. Each animal you add to your zoo increases the number of visitors your zoo attracts, and ultimately the most popular zoo wins.

Play is round based. Each round, players draw cards which might include money to bid on auctions or tricks to use against their opponents. New animals and powerful effects are then revealed and placed up for auction. Players get a chance to place blind bids on auctions that interest them and use their tricks to tip odds in their favor. Once everyone has played, the bids are revealed. It is important to bid wisely because losing bids are lost.

Acquiring pairs of animals allows them to mate, produce babies and increase your visitor count for FREE. However, savvy zookeepers always have extra cash on hand to protect their investments from the dangerous cards that come up for auction.

gadZooks! is fast and easy to learn which makes a great game for kids or non-gamers. However, there is enough nuance and strategy to keep more discerning gamers interested.

170642.name: Cosplay: The Game
170642.description:
In COSPLAY: The Game, two to four players compete against each other to try to become a Cosplay Superstar. Using a variety of cards and events, players gather flair for their costumes, then compete in tournaments to advance their rank. The first player to achieve "Superstar" status wins the game.

A game built from the ground up by cosplayers for cosplayers, you'll recognize many in-game items inspired by and making fun of tropes from your favorite cosplay fandoms. Each player chooses a fandom (video games, anime & TV, steampunk or super heroes) and then works to gather flair for their cosplay before the competition. Flair items range from the ordinary (a "dinosaur egg" or a "steampunk gauntlet") to the outlandish (like the "companion sphere" or the "ridiculous oversized hat").

Easy to learn and play and incredibly portable, it's a perfect game to play when you're stuck in a hotel, at the airport or otherwise looking to have some fun. It's a clever take on the cosplay/convention experience, in playing card form.

170643.name: Glitch Iteration (Revised)
170643.description:
From the introduction

This is a moving-around game.
Every player portrays iterations of someone named Uri, incorrectly loaded into an artificial world. Not pieces, but incomplete copies. Are you a glitch? Are you a virus? Can you be the real Uri even though you don't feel real?

The game seeks to help you explore identity and doubt, and to help you re-contextualize the world around you. It’s not an investigation game so much as an introspection game.

It’s for 4-8 players who have a beautiful space to move around in, best with additional foot traffic.

From the afterword
Glitch Iteration was made for the Golden Cobra Challenge, and won in the category of Cleverest Design. This polished version was made possible by my patrons and will appear in the Golden Cobra collection.

170644.name: HC SVNT DRACONES Core Rulebook
rpgpodcastepisode: Hc Svnt Dracones – Echoes of the Past – Episode 1
Hc Svnt Dracones – Echoes of the Past – Episode 2
Hc Svnt Dracones – Echoes of the Past – Episode 3
Hc Svnt Dracones – Echoes of the Past – Episode 4
170644.description:
From publisher blurb:

HC SVNT DRACONES puts you in the body of a human experiment that outlived its creator, and has gone on expanding into the galaxy while trying to heed the lessons of a race that fell to ruin. It's about exploration and fear, expansion and conquest, intrigue and subterfuge, and ultimately, it’s about you, learning to be you, when all the trappings of humanity you define yourself with are dead and gone.

This new and original RPG setting in the post-human Sol system features a dynamic dice system that allows players to approach problems from a variety of angles, rather than using a single blunt-force solution for everything. Learn about the 8-10-12 dice system in the book.

170645.name: December 2014 Free Monster of the Month: Snow Lurker
170645.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting the Snow Lurker an all-new free monster for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

"This pale creature stands atop three unusually long legs. Its oddly-shaped mouth filled with razor-sharp teeth."

The snow lurker is an all-new arctic aberration and a perfect addition to the arctic adventure options provided in U-02: Holiday Heroes & Horrors.

170646.name: Fair Go
170646.description:
Played similarly to Monopoly, players use dice to move around a board and buy industries. The goal of the game is to have the best reputation for philanthropy and social justice.

As in Monopoly, any player landing on an industry space owned by another player must pay the owner. However, a player may become "the best in their industry" by giving up their move and paying 2,000 in currency to purchase a ring. When a player lands on an industry space with a ring, the owner of that industry must pay the active player. This represents the social responsibility of being the best in an industry.

To win the game, a player must have four rings on four different industries he owns. He also must land exactly on the Charity Shop space and pay 2,000 in currency.

170647.name: Monegassen Ramsch
170647.description:
Monegassen Ramsch contains one Dimension Card and 32 play cards (Ramsche). At the start of the game every player has seven cards on his hand and an empty discard pile in front of him. The goal is to get rid of your cards by placing them into the other player's discard pile. You get points for every card that's in the other players's discard pile.

The main mechanic is similar to Ramschrounds in Skat plus four special effects cards. As you play you can always choose in which discard pile you want to play your card. Sometimes you want to play them in your own, because of these effects like "mirror the discard piles" etc.

170648.name: 47 Key Concepts for Inventing a Fantasy Race or Culture
170648.description:
From publisher blurb:

Men, dwarves, elves, orcs, trolls, and goblins. These races, and many more like them, populate nearly every fantasy world ever created. Their societies, cultures, and histories have been covered in countless books, movies, video and role playing games.

Sometimes though, when DM/GMs decide to build their own fantasy world, they realize they need to populate it with their own creations; races, cultures and civilizations unique to their beloved game world and its mythos. Though there's nothing wrong with goblins, from time to time its nice to spice things up a bit with something original and fresh.

Here, we will provide you with 47 key concepts and questions to ask yourself when you create your own unique race, culture, or civilization for your world. From the smallest barbarian tribe to the most powerful civilization in your world, these questions will help you breathe life into your various human and non-human cultures alike.

By taking just a few minutes with each question, within no time you can quickly weave epic myths and legends, come up with the origins of their holidays and rituals, and determine the strengths, weaknesses, and destiny of your new culture, race, or civilization.

We have included in this guide an example race from the upcoming Greystaff: Legends Role Playing Game known as the Gorrhym in order to better explain how these key concepts come together and work.

170649.name: 47 Villainous Plots to Ruin Your Party's Day
170649.description:
From publisher blurb:

Evildoer… Tyrant... Nemesis…

These are the people (or monsters) who drive your game’s narrative, giving shape to the wicked plans you’ve come up with, and serving up all manner of nasty plots and schemes for the heroes of the story to foil. Whether they inhabit a dark, crumbling tower at the edge of civilization, a deep, dark cave in the highlands, or the castle looming mightily over oppressed lands, villains take many forms.

In this guide, you will find seven archetypes of villain: The Villain Within, The Good-Guy (or Girl) Gone Wrong, The Avenger, The Great Tyrant, The Hidden Master, The Nemesis, and The Beast.

Listed under each of these archetypes is a number of plots specific to their methods and means for use in your campaigns. As always, we at Blackstone Entertainment Inc hope these plotlines will help to inspire and aid GMs/DMs in their campaigns, and provide many hours of excitement for Players as well!

170650.name: 47 Ways to Create Great NPCs for Your Campaigns
170650.description:
From publisher blurb:

What does it take to create a living, breathing world? GMs and DMs often spend a great deal of time trying to capture and project a certain feel for their games. Mood, setting, depth of character and history - all of these things are necessary for a truly vibrant fantasy world. This might look like a lot of work, and sometimes it is - but for enterprising GMs/DMs, much of the illusion can be achieved through the creation of realistic, well-thought out, and believable NPCs.

The keys to creating such NPCs are memorable descriptions, vibrant personalities, and personal motivations and goals. Pick and choose which of these listed details you want to use, and breathe life into even your simplest encounters. Give a splash of color to every burly village blacksmith, gruff town merchant, and evil, despotic villain in your campaign.

The following list will help to provide you with the right tools to get that done, from deciding the NPC's general mannerisms to fleshing out their history and secrets to figuring out how they are connected to the other NPCs and organizations in your campaign world.

170651.name: 47 Ancient Scrolls, Maps, and Handouts to Spice up Your Game Night
170651.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the faint candle-light flickers about the walls of the underground chamber, your eyes are drawn to an old piece of parchment lying on a table in the corner of the room. A century of dust and debris covers the parchment, but you can just make out the outlines of – something – drawn or written upon it. What do your characters do?

Perhaps more importantly, what do you, as the DM/GM do? You can either tell your players what’s on the parchment, or you can show them. With 47 Ancient Scrolls, Maps, and Handouts, we’ve done most of the work for you. Within these pages, you will find a literal treasure-trove of RPG handouts containing many parchment templates - some are blank, while others are bear wax seals, are torn and weathered, water or blood-stained, or decorated with unique borders or runic symbols. Additionally, this product contains several maps you can use in your games!

170652.name: 47 Critical Hit Tables to Spice Up Your Game
170652.description:
From publisher blurb:

As gamers, our Saturday nights often revolve around dice. Sometimes, those dice are our tormentors - letting us down at the worst possible moment, or keeping us from succeeding in our endeavors time after time.

Thankfully, this is not one of those times!

The Critical Success is one of the highlights of any gaming night, and no great story is complete without the well-timed and much needed Crit. Your character manages to do the impossible, or at least the unthinkable, and the well-crafted plans of your GM/DM are laid to ruin before your mighty d20!

The following product gives you the tools to turn your drab old "your swing does double damage" routine into an exciting and often unpredictable triumph. From results that eviscerate your enemies, to Critical Successes that rally your allies and lend strength to their blows, these 47 tables are sure to deliver countless hours of fun.

Remember, all products in the '47 Series' line are d20 fantasy-based, but system neutral so you can easily adapt them to any game system you want!

170653.name: 47 Fantasy Adventure Hooks: Bringing Your PCs Together With Style
170653.description:
From publisher blurb:

The game begins...

You find yourselves in a tavern. The warm glow of the hearth casts its bloody light about the smoke-filled room, as weary and grim-faced travelers huddle over their drinks, eying you suspiciously. Suddenly, for no discernible reason, you band together with 4-6 other people you've never met, trusting one another instantly with your lives, your wealth, and your future!

If this is how your games have been beginning lately, maybe its time to shake things up a bit. Within this product, you will find 47 fun, imaginative and inspired ways to bring your PCs together for the campaign ahead. No more barfight cliches, no more forced party composition, and most importantly - no more uninspired opening scenes to start your campaign!

47 Fantasy Adventure Hooks is completely system-neutral, and provides you with simple but exciting options to start out your next adventure.

Harness up, stow your supplies, and ready yourselves for the road! The adventure is about to begin...

170654.name: L'Arc-en-Ciel des Tenebres
170654.description:
user summary

The table of contents reveal that the module details the geography and famous persons of "Les royaumes à l'est de shog", and contains 2 scenarios.

The credits list one of the scenarios as being designed for a tournament in Toulon, France, in 1988, and that some material was published earlier in issue no. 46 of Casus Belli magazine.

170655.name: Aventures pour Animonde
170655.description:
From the introduction (translated from french):

"This extension includes several scenarios for Animonde, with one thing in common: they allow playing only one person. This way of playing is quite different from playing a party group."

170656.name: Shotguns & Sorcery Core Book
170656.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Explore the fantasy noir campaign setting Shotguns & Sorcery™. Written by S&S author, Matt Forbeck, and powered by the just announced Cypher System™ from Monte Cook Games, the Shotguns & Sorcery core book contains all you need to play in one book. Defy the power of the Imperial Dragon Guard. Try your luck against the undead outside the Great Circle. New challenges, old foes and allies: a whole new setup to explore.

Shotguns & Sorcery is set in Dragon City, a grim and gritty fantasy metropolis built on top of and inside of a walled-off mountain and ruled over by the Dragon Emperor. Legions of zombies scratch at the cut stones of the Great Circle every hour of the night, trying to tear the wall down for their mysterious necromantic commander, the Ruler of the Dead.

Inside the wall, the people work and scheme to find an edge and get ahead on the city’s dark alleys and magically lit streets. The green-skinned folk squat down in Goblintown, stacked right up against the wall, where they can hear the constant moaning of the dead all night long. Above them, the rest of the survivors live in neighborhoods of their own, each stratified by their longevity and social standing, which make for the kind of barriers no hack on an enchanted carpet can fly you past.

Robbing the ruins that lay outside the Great Circle is illegal, but it’s the best way for people with questionable talents with rune-laced shotguns to keep the gold flowing. And most days it beats selling dragon essence to the addicts who use it to fuel their magics, or hiring out as muscle for the dwarven gangs. As long as you keep your nose clean and give a wide berth to the Imperial Guard, there’s a fortune to be made in Dragon City.

Just hope you live long enough to enjoy it.

170658.name: Cheat Your Own Adventure
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 54 - Fall of Magic, Cheat Your Own Adventure, Witch: The Road to Lindisfarne
170658.description:
From the Game:

A good-natured Game Poem parodying the Adventure Books of old.
For three or more players (best with four or five)
Relax, no actual poetry involved!

You eagerly open the book at page 1 and begin your journey of page-flips and hard choices. Ahead of you lies an adventure in which you decide your destiny! Maybe this is the book you will get through without dying? If not, there's always a do-over.

What are you waiting for? Go and cheat your own adventure!

170660.name: Don't Starve Together
videogamehonor: 2016 Steam Awards Better With Friends Nominee
170660.description:
Don's Starve Together is a standalone multiplayer version of the wilderness survival game Don't Starve from Klei Entertainment only available for PC/Steam. It features all the content of the original game Don't Starve and the Reign of Giants expansion but with the ability for several players to play together either cooperatively or competitively online. Several tweaks were implemented to try and balance the game for multiple players.

The game stars a number of different characters who have all been transported to a strange world by a demonic creature known simply as Maxwell. Players takes on the role of one of the stranded characters and must survive from day to day by foraging for food and supplies, forging equipment and dealing with the various perils of the Don't Starve world which include changing weather and seasons, environmental hazards, and physical and supernatural monsters, all whilst trying to keep healthy, well fed and mentally stable.

Don't Starve features a strong rogue-like element, with perma-death and little in game help or instruction making surviving the game's randomly generated wilderness both tough and unforgiving. It's relatively well known for an Indie game, mainly thanks to a number of lets-plays on Youtube, and features a unique Tim Burton-inspired gothic-cartoon art style.

After the success of Don't Starve several expansions have since been released, although its worth noting that other then the Reign of Giants expansion which is already implemented into the game they are only compatible with the original Don't Starve, and not Don't Starve Together.

170661.name: Disney Fairies: Fly and Go Seek Game
170661.description:
Disney Fairies: Fly and Go Seek Game is a princess themed memory game.

Object: to fly around the house collecting Treasure Triangles. At the end of the game, the player with the most Treasure Triangles is the winner!

Set Up
1) Decide on four locations around your house to place Treasure Triangles (for example, the kitchen, bedroom, dining room, entry way). These are the places you'll "fly" to!
2) In each location, place six Treasure Triangles as shown. (Wedges meet to form a hexagon). It does not matter which sides are face-up.
3) Everyone sits in a central location.
4) Put all the square Cards inside the bag.
5) Have the sand timer handy.

The player with the next birthday goes first!

On Your Turn:
Reach in the bag and, without looking, pull out a Card. Follow the instructions below based on what kind of Card you pulled:

Picture Card




If you pulled a Picture Card, look at the items on both sides of the Card. Choose one of the sides to place face-up in the center of all the players. Now it's the next player's turn.

Moon Card




If you pulled a Moon Card, place it off to the side to begin creating a picture of a full moon. If the fourth Moon Card is pulled and the picture of the full moon is complete, the game is over (see Ending the Game section below). Otherwise it's the next player's turn.

"Fly and Go Seek" Card




If you pulled a "Fly and Go Seek" Card, follow the directions below:
1) Take a look at ALL the face-up Picture Cards. Try to remember the items on them, but leave them where they are. (Note: if there are no face-up Picture Cards then your turn is over because there are no items to seek, and now it's the next players' turn.)
2) Flip the sand timer over and go!
3) Hurry to the Treasure Triangles around your house. If you see items from face-up Picture Cards on any Treasure Triangles take those Treasure Triangles, take those Treasure Triangles with you.
4) When the sand timer runs out, another player should let you know. Immediately come back with any Treasure Triangles you have collected.
5) Compare the Treasure Triangles you have collected to the face-up Picture Cards. Place each treasure Triangle you have collected that matches a Picture Card in your own scoring pile. Set the matching Picture Cards out of the game.
6) If you collected a Treasure Trinagle that does not have a matching face-up Picture Card, put the Treasure Triangle back and your next turn is skipped. Now it's the next player's turn.

Ending the Game
When the fourth Moon Card is pulled from thebag and the picture of the full moon is complete, the game is over. Players count up the Treasure Triangles they have collected. The player with the most Treasure Triangles wins!

170662.name: Cloister
170662.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Cloister is a story-based roleplaying game about untrustworthy memories, shattered hallucinations, and psychonormal vistas. Characters are test subjects in an experiment of psychological and biological abnormalities devoid of moral restraints. As the story unfolds the subjects will question their own sanity and the reality around them. As the experiment inches closer and closer to its inevitable and tragic conclusion, the characters may not survive the horror-filled event intact. Or at all.

This one pushes the bounds of sanity. Expect weird.

170663.name: The Doom King
170663.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Doom King is a story roleplaying game about a tired leader who has brought his nation to the edge of ruin. The characters are advisors, confidantes, glad-handers, loyalists, and sycophants insulating their leader from his failed kingdom. All the while, the king makes worse and worse decisions for the realm. Is it madness or sheer ignorance that drives the king? Can the characters save the kingdom from perdition? Or will the king drag them all down with him?

170664.name: Colonial Lies
170664.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Colonial Lies is a story roleplaying game about secrecy and distrust set in the years before the American revolution. Wealthy “traders” of Jamestown cannot trust the Tidewater elite and the homogenous Puritans of the New England see new Amsterdam as a threat to their way of life. As such, the colonies have placed agents everywhere. Players take on the roles of spies, in service to the developing nation, in an attempt to undermine the clashing virtues of the colonies. Will the burgeoning America survive?

In Colonial Lies, the enemy is not the British, or even Mad King George III, but the other ‘nations’ of pre-America, who are trying to maintain their wealth and independence at any cost. Everyone is a potential traitor against the might of the burgeoning nation — now faced with new threats at every corner. Can the colonies survive in spite of themselves?

170665.name: The New World: A Colonial 4x Game
170665.description:
The year is 1600. You've been appointed Governor of a small struggling settlement in the New World with instructions to explore and settle these new lands for the Glory of your King and country. However, your nation is not alone in these new lands. For your colony to survive you will have to bargain with the powerful Native tribes and deal with your Nation's enemies who also have settlements here.

The New World is a 4x tile laying game for 3-4 players set in Colonial North America. Players can either play the French, English, Spanish, or Dutch with the goal of building your empire and collecting Glory for the Crown. Since each game will feature random exploration by laying tiles, no two games will play the same.
You will win this game by exploring, building your settlements by claiming and purchasing land from the Native tribes, and eventually coming into conflict with your country's competitors in the New World. All this will build up Glory Points in the name of your King.

The game plays quickly with each player on their turn having a choice of a single action from either:

1) Exploring: Paying to launch expeditions to place tiles, claim/purchase land, and placing influence markers (representing traders and missionaries) in the hopes of Allying and trading with the tribes.
2) Economic Turn: Building up your Colony by creating new settlements, building Forts, repairing settlements that were damaged, maintaining troops, and collecting wealth from taxes and trade
3) War: Eventually you will have to deal with the enemies of your King here in the The New World. If you choose this action this is where you will raise your armies and send them across the frontiers. Be forewarned though. War is not cheap. You will need a strong economy to wage successful war. There is only so much that the Crown can do to help your fledgling colony.

The New World is buffed by a large Event deck that brings out the historical events of the times. It also serves to pace the game by having Events that represent the Peace Treaties that ended the big European Wars that spilled over into North America. Whenever a Peace Event is drawn, there will be a few turns of truce and Glory Points will be awarded based on the number of Settlements, the number of claimed territories, and by your Alliances with the Native Tribes. Once 3 Peace Events are drawn the game will be over.

This game is rather unique by it's Exploration/Tile laying mechanic, it's quick engaging turns, it's streamlined easy rules including a nice combat resolution, the ability to bounce back from a disaster, and and a unique, more historical, representation of the native tribes.

170666.name: Destiny - Expansion I: The Dark Below
170666.description:
User Summary

Destiny - The Dark Below adds new weapons, armor, and gear as well as new story quests and missions and a new cooperative Strike and Raid with three new competitive multiplayer arenas.

170667.description:
Help pair up each of the animal types and Simba and Nala's daughter, Kiara, with Kovu the male cub she has fallen in love with.

The game is a variant on a memory match game, but the pairs are a male and female of a species and the male and female tiles are different shapes, that form a heart shape when matched.

The game also comes with a display area that is set up to the side of the play area where all the matched pairs are placed.
170667.name: The Lion King: Simba's Pride – Pride Rock Pairs

170668.name: Dark Souls II: Scholar of the First Sin
videogamecompilation: Dark Souls II - The Crown of the Ivory King
Dark Souls II - The Crown of the Old Iron King
Dark Souls II - The Crown of the Sunken King
170668.description:
User Summary

Dark Souls II: Scholar of the First Sin is an enhanced release of Dark Souls II with updated visuals, rebalanced gameplay, new enemies, a new NPC to discover, expanded lore, new in-game events, and a higher maximum number of players for online play. Scholar of the First Sin will be bundled with all three DLC missions.

170669.description:
Old School Tactical is a new system for tactical level war-games. This first game involves small unit engagements are fought on the Eastern Front during 1941-42.
Players contest each scenario using counters representing the soldiers, guns and vehicles that fought these battles.
The unique Impulse system varies the number of actions each side can take in a turn, creating intense firefights. Play moves back and forth between players and the dynamics of the battle can 'turn on a dime'.
170669.name: Old School Tactical

170670.name: Jinrou: Usotsuki Wa Dare Da? Card Battle
170670.description:
This game is based on a Japanese comedy game series 人狼〜嘘つきは誰だ?〜.
There are 17 types of roles.
And if you are the werewolf you would have to get rid of the humans until you have the same number of werewolves as the humans do. And humans are to get rid of the werewolves.
However, there is a third force, the fox. The fox wins if he lives on till the end of the game.

The 17 types are namely:
Staple Characters:
Villager 市民 - No Effects
Werewolf 人狼 - Kill someone during the night (werewolf will know who the other werewolf is)
Knight 騎士 - Protect one person from attack by werewolf except himself in the night
Fortune Teller 占い師 - During the night you can see who is a werewolf, a villager or fox (however, you are unable to see their profession, or if the person was cursed)
Betrayer 裏切り者 - Part werewolf team and part villager team, can sway both ways.

Additional Characters:
The Twins 双子 - Can know who your twin is and confirm that he/she is a villager
The Medium 霊媒師 - Able to see the person who was voted off in the morning trial if the person was a werewolf or not
Apprentice Knight なりきり騎士 - similar power as the knight, but you die in the process
The Infected 感染者 - becomes a werewolf when attacked
Pied Piper Pierot 道連れピエロ - able to select someone else to die with him when selected by the werewolf as an attack target or when voted off
The Cursed 呪われし者 - a villager but when seen by the fortune teller or medium, he becomes the bait for the night
The Weak 病弱 - Become the designated person to die from the werewolf attack on the night = number of werewolves+1 from the start of the game
The calm senate 冷徹な議長 - able to void other peoples votes and count only his in 1 of the trials. Once per game
Thick Haired Laborer 毛深き労働者 - Shows up as a werewolf, but actually is a villager
Sturdy Sailor 屈強な船乗り - when attacked by the werewolf, he dies on the second night
Disciple of the Fortune Teller 占い師の弟子 - Becomes a fortune teller when the fortune teller dies
Assassin 暗殺者- select a person to assassinate in the night, the effects of knight or apprentice knight is voided
Demonic Magic User 妖術師 - Able to fortune tell someone and show it to the werewolves. However, he becomes the attacked person in the night. Villager Team
Targeted Villager 狙われる市民 - Start out as a villager team, but turns to a werewolf when attacked
Werewolf Child 人狼の子 - Startout as a villager but after =number of werewolves at the start of the game + 1 night, turns into a werewolf
Fox Demon 狐憑き - your goal is to just survive and you win
Witch Doctor闇医者

170671.description:
Originally from Hawaii, her knowledge of survival and hunting were taught to her from a young age by her father. Once a demolitions expert in the military, she worked with mercenaries all across the country, until she found herself outside the Golden City...

Cora is the 6th character of Raid & Trade and in this expansion, you will discover a new ability. The ability of detonation!
170671.name: Raid & Trade: Cora the Specialist

170673.name: 12 Realms: Ancestors Legacy Dark Lords Pack
170673.description: All the eight Dark Lords gathered in the same box! Koschei, Thanatos, Ifrit, Marid, Circe, Chernomor, Sobek, & Anubis. In each Realm are corresponded two different Dark Lords. This pack includes all the Dark Lords corresponding to the 12 Realms: Ancestors Legacy boxed game.

170674.name: Prison Run
170674.description:
Free your falsely accused friends from a closely guarded prison! Be the first to help other players escape before wardens realize what’s happening and thwart your plans. Unfortunately, not everyone can succeed, so you need to choose carefully when to help others, when to obstruct them, and when to bluff your way out. Maybe your strategy will be the most effective. It’s time to begin Prison Run!

In Prison Run, each player tries to bail his companions out of jail. The cards with the list of prisoners who are the members of the player’s gang should not be revealed to the other players. To make escape of their people possible, the players use simple actions. They can choose the prisoner who will break out from the cell or who will be move forward on the escape track. If one of the prisoners will make it to the last space, the players votes secretly if the prisoner will successfully escape or will go back to the cell. If at least one of the voters is against the escape, the prisoner returns to the jail. However, the players have to be careful and count their odds, because each player has limited amount of the objections.

The player who at the end of the game has the largest number of bailed out prisoners from their gang is the winner.

170675.name: ZigZak: Skoki narciarskie
170675.description:
Challenge the best ski jumpers in the world! See for yourself that you can become one of the sports champions! “ZigZak: Ski Jumps” is a party card game, in which players become ski jumpers trying to fly as far as possible and take the longest and the best jump.

In ZigZak: Skoki narciarskie (ZigZag: Ski Jumps) game all the players perform their jumps in the real time simultaneously. In order to win, the players have to create the line of their jumps using cards from the common pool by putting together their Start and Finish cards. The speed, the style and the length of the jump are all important. The players have to prove their reflex and accuracy while selecting the cards.

170676.description:
Nosocomio is a card game created by doctors for the whole family.

Become a supervisor in a NOSOCOMO CORPORATION's hospital plant and cheat, steal, poison and destroy your opponents' plans for victory! You'll have to void all your beds or heal 5 sick people.

The game includes 122 game cards.


(In Spanish:) NOSOCOMIO es un juego de cartas ideado por médicos para toda la familia.

Conviértete en jefe de una planta entera de NOSOCOMIO CORPORATION y engaña, roba, envenena o desbarata los planes de los demás para ganar: sólo uno será quien triunfe! Quien pueda vaciar todas sus camas o curar a 5 enfermos -igual da que se trate de El Güalkin Ded, de Rosa la Migrañosa o del Abueloma- ascenderá y conservará su cabellera.
Por suerte, para ello no estás solo: cuentas con la ayuda de un envidiable surtido de profesionales, recursos y triquiñuelas que te harán la vida más fácil -y más difícil a tus contrincantes-: el Chamán, el bisturí oxidado, el autobús del Imserso o invitaciones "All in" para el Congreso de las Bahamas. Entre muchos otros! En NOSOCOMIO hay un total de 122 cartas de juego.
170676.name: Nosocomio

170677.name: Eldritch Archeologist Hybrid Class
170677.description:
From publisher blurb:

Forgotten secrets and ancient treasures lurk in lost tombs waiting to be unearthed by the brave.

Those adventurers courageous enough to devote themselves to answering these mysteries are the Eldritch Archeologists. With knowledge and firepower they breach the old wards and protections of buried tombs and ruined monasteries to uncover that which has been purposely hidden. Will never before seen revelations lead the eldritch archeologist to new impossible and inconceivable truths? What will your Archeologist find?

Included:

The Archeologist hybrid class, a Bard/Gunslinger who uses luck and firearms to find lost relics.
A detailed Deeds list tailored to the archeologist.
A premade Eldritch Archeologist for immediate use!

170678.name: Spiker
170678.description:
From publisher blurb:

A nightmare weapon from the old wars has returned!

From the ancient conflicts that caused the final collapse of human civilization, these bear sized military bio-weapons continue to wreak havoc into the new era. Encountered as wild predators or armored sentinels for high tech enclaves, Spikers are murderous foes and a serious challenge to any excavation team.

Designed and written by Danny Seedhouse, the Spiker is our 9th free Creature of the Apocalypse. This brute comes in both a wild and armored variant with the wild specimen often exhibiting extra mutations, while the armored version comes equipped with a rich assortment of randomly determined back-mounted relic firepower.

Crafted to confront mid to high rank characters, these freaky, unpredictable monsters bring some serious firepower to the table, and can dish out the sort of ranged attack abilities that normally only player characters enjoy.

This is a 6 page PDF and includes a full page image of cover art for use as a player handout.

170679.description:
Material

A 10x10 grid made of dots and two color pencils or markers in two colors.

Play

Decide who will go first, turns then alternate,

• On a turn draw one-line segment in your color either vertically or horizontally
between two dots.
• No dot on the board may have more than three-line segments drawn out from
it.

The game ends when the board is full.

Scoring

An area is considered closed when no line segments can be drawn within that
area, as soon as an area is closed, count the line segments of each color that
makes up that closed area.

The player with the most line segments in his color enclosing an area places his
initial within that area to show ownership and then gets to draw another line.
A line segment that closes two areas is counted for each area (making it counted
twice, once per area). An area is not scored when an equal number of line segments in both colors surround it.

Objective

The player with the most initials on the board at the end of the game is the winner.
170679.name: Thicket

170680.name: Starter Adventures
170680.description:
From publisher blurb:

Starter Adventures is where you learn to fight, steal, cast spells and heal. You'll have to use your wits to figure out puzzles. Use a sword to murderize goblins. And crumble the undead beneath the power of your god.

It's time to grab a weapon, memorize a spell and strap on some armor. This is going to be fun.

Starter Adventures is targeted toward introduing a new player into RPGs. Inside are four short adventures for each of the four main classes, a tavern to hangout in, and a full-fledged adventure when they've got enough blood encrusted on their blades.

170681.name: Vacant Ritual Assembly (Issue 1 - Winter 2014)
rpgissuearticle: Into the Odd with Chris McDowall
Luminari, the Lady of the Golden Lamp
170681.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vacant Ritual Assembly is a brand new OSR zine. Directly compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess, but easily adaptable to other OSR games. 22-pages of content, 100% of which comes straight from my weekly LotFP campaign.

Issue #1 includes:

Dope Artwork from Corey Brin, Abigail Larson, and Sean Poppe
The Ghoul Market: Beneath a defiled chapel, the scavengers of the dead emerge from their tunnels to barter with the living and the damned. PCs bold enough to do business here can emerge with powerful magic, but what will they leave behind?
Meet the Skinsmith: A corpulent cyclopean demon who will perform voluntary surgical procedures on your PCs. Magical tattoos, hideous resurrections, artisanal cadavers!
Vespero the Antiquarian: A strange, sickly man who runs the curiosity shoppe at the end of the row. A weird “quest hub” NPC whose shop might offer PCs a glimpse of the Ghoul Market’s wares.
Luminari, Lady of the Golden Lamp: A strange firefly goddess from the deep woods.
Brahnwick is Dead: Complete one-session adventure. A flooded town overrun by madmen. An abandoned keep. A lake monster?
An interview with Chris McDowall about his new opus Into the Odd.
Greycandle Manor: An abandoned manor on the edge of town, ready for your PCs to inhabit and/or explore, but what’s up with that hole in the basement?

170682.description:
official Miniatures for Thunderbolt Apache Leader


from the Dan Verssen Games (DVG) website

The Thunderbolt-Apache Leader Miniatures Set provides you with 81 1/600th scale metal miniatures. The miniatures are cast in metal and are 1/600th scale. These are perfect to use on your TAL tactical terrain hexes.

The miniatures come in unpainted silver, but they can be painted.

The set includes:
10 x T-72s (Tanks)
10 x BTR-70s (APCs)
4 x 2S1s (SPA)
5 x SA-9s (SAM Vehicles)
5 x ZSU-23-4 (AAA Vehicles)
4 x Mi-24 Hinds (Helicopters)
8 x ZiL-151s (Trucks)
5 x ZU-23-2s (AAA Sites)
13 x Infantry (Infantry)
4 x Scud-Bs (Scuds)
4 x HEMMTs (Command Vehicles)
3 x AH-64 Apaches
2 x A-10 Thunderbolts
1 x F-16 Fighting Falcon
2 x AH-1 Cobras
1 x MQ-1 Predator

The set does not include the Buildings, Storage Tanks, AV-8B Harrier II’s, or AC-130 Spectres.

Manufactured by Pico Armor.
170682.name: Thunderbolt-Apache Leader Miniatures Set

170684.name: Barbarians, Booze, & Battle Axes!
170684.description:
From publisher blurb:

Barbarians, Booze, & Battle Axes is a role playing game of big barbarians who love to drink and fight!

You can drink, fight, and show how tough you are all the way to glory. And other stuff too. The unique d100 system makes sure your numbers are as big as your battles and belches. We've also included 50 monsters for you to fight, some drinking games, and a solo adventure too.

Good for a night filled with nothing else to do!

170685.name: Giants!: Being a short supplement for Barbarians, Booze, & Battle Axes
170685.description:
From publisher blurb:

Giants is a short supplement for the Barbarians, Booze, & Battle Axes RPG. It covers seven varieties of giants as beasties to fight or using them as player characters.

170687.name: Myriad Song Preview
170687.description:
From publisher blurb:

MYRIAD SONG is a tribute to the New Wave of Science Fiction... to progressive rock and sci-fi comic books... to Rush, King Crimson, and Hawkwind ... to Incal, Valerian, and Rourke... to Heavy Metal, Dune and Fifth Element. Journey to unknown spheres both real and imagined, because matter is merely atoms vibrating with frequency, and the difference between harmony and discord can be either an eyelash's breadth or a distant star. Converse with strange aliens, fall in with dangerous cults, stand on impossible skyscrapers that preside over undiscovered landscapes. The dangers are great, but the rewards are even greater. Will you heed the sirens of the MYRIAD SONG?

In the darkness of ages past, our universe was visited by aliens strange and unknowable. They enslaved hundreds of people and they conquered thousands of worlds. For untold generations, the Myriad people served them, and worlds were stripped of all resources, and left barren and dead. And then, a century ago, the Syndics were gone. Did they retreat to another universe? Are they hiding on undiscovered worlds, in radio silence? Interplanetary factions spread their philosophy from place to place. The Solar Creed offers the people free energy . . . at the price of their freedom and liberty. The technologists of the Concord push forward with their new science, for better or for ill. What mysterious dangers lurk in the unknown voids of space?

A complete game in one volume, MYRIAD SONG is a science-fiction adventure where you will travel in the strange legacy of an alien empire. Discover primitive worlds with savage monsters . . . high-tech stations of amazing technology . . . derelict planets where people scrounge out a living among the ruins . . . and places far stranger. You will find lost treasures . . . and you will find horrors best forgotten. The risks are great, but the rewards are greater.

Built using the Cardinal rules engine (as seen in IRONCLAW, NOGGLE STONES, and USAGI YOJIMBO RPG), our game lets you build your character to be as straightforward or as complex as you like. Play a no-nonsense adventurer ready for anything, or play a master specialist who has no equal in their field. Play an ordinary human thrust into extra-ordinary circumstances, or play a fantastic alien or machine, made from unknown science and with powers and abilities far beyond our normal space. Work with exotic alien materials to build savage and strange weapons, or use advanced technology to make cybernetic enhancements to make what you need, when you need it. Bluff your way past the secret police, or rob some petty lord of their ill-gotten riches, or fly a spaceship to vistas beyond any known horizon.

Lavishly illustrated in full color from some of the top talents working in science fiction, our game brings the worlds of your vivid imagination to you, and lets you make your story. Are you ready to heed the clarion call of the alien spheres, the music that is the MYRIAD SONG?

170688.name: Age of Craft Expansion #1: Blueprints and Visitors
boardgamepublisher: Chicken Dice Games (チキンダイスゲームズ)
170688.description:
This expansion for Age of Craft introduces two new sets of cards, Blueprints and Visitors, along with new rules for their use. It also includes two new random cards that can be used with the base game rules.

Blueprints begin in a face down stack. Each player is dealt two random Blueprints at the beginning of the game and can choose to purchase more during the building phase. Blueprints can either be events, which are discarded after use, or they can be buildings that are constructed in the same manner as the buildings on offer in the common supply. There is no limit to the number of Bluprints that a player may purchase.

Visitor cards are goals that offer points to the player who meets their requirements. Two Visitor cards are drawn randomly at the beginning of the game. Once a player has obtained a Visitor card, an opponent may take it by surpassing the requirements met by the owner of the card.

170689.name: Mura Korogashi: France
boardgamepublisher: 植民地戦争+α (Shokuminchi Sensou Plus Alpha)
170689.description: This expansion for the game Mura Korogashi includes 11 new types of tiles that allow players to build a village in France.

170690.name: Mura Korogashi: Spain
boardgamepublisher: 植民地戦争+α (Shokuminchi Sensou Plus Alpha)
170690.description: This expansion for the game Mura Korogashi includes 11 new types of tiles that allow players to build a village in Spain.

170691.description:
Go with the Floe is a two-player abstract chase game. The seal player wants to isolate the seals beyond the reach of the pursuing polar bears. The polar bear player wins if both seals are caught, otherwise the seal player wins.

Components
Modified 8 x 8 board with 52 ice spaces
2 black seal tokens and 2 white polar bear tokens.
50 hole-in-the-ice ring markers

Game Play
Starting with the Black player, players take turns moving one of their tokens. A player may pass a turn only if he or she has no legal move.
Either player tokens can:
1) Move one or two empty spaces in any one direction, like a range-restricted chess queen, or
2) Move by jumping over one ring marker in any direction into an empty space, as in checkers but without capturing or multiple jumps.

Captures
Only White may capture an opponent’s token and this can only be done from an adjacent space, like a chess king. On capturing both the white and black tokens are removed from play leaving the capture space empty.

After moving or capturing, the moving player places a hole-in-the-ice ring marker on the moving token’s starting space and any empty space passed over.

Game End
The game ends when one of the following occurs:
* The White player captures both Black tokens. White wins.
* The Black player has one token isolated and which cannot be captured. Black wins.
* Both players pass on consecutive turns. Black wins.
170691.name: Go with the Floe

170692.name: The Children of Blackweb Bog
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
170692.description:
From the front cover:

An adventure for 4-6 characters levels 3-4. Compatible with 1E/OSRIC/LL AEC.

From the back cover:

Lorview, a tranquil small town, friendly folks, open farm fields, and dark secrets that brew in the bog. None dare to venture near Blackweb Bog.
