The inner circle has divined the secrets of the tablets, enhancing their already formidable magical abilities with new understanding.

Demon Cults: The Emerald Order includes:

A new cultist prestige class, the Emerald Disciple
Fully detailed cult leader with complete stats (CR 12)
Plots and adventure hooks for party levels 1 to 12
New magic items including an emerald shard ioun stone and the Emerald Tablets artifact
A new smaragdine golem, fully illustrated




Give your villains a little arcane boost. Show your players a new challenge with Demon Cults: The Emerald Order today!

170880.name: Vendors
170880.description:
Take on the role of the IT director of a large enterprise - a telecom, bank, or energy company. Compete in the technology race, acquiring the most innovative software from leading providers in order to efficiently serve your customers and gain new ones. your number of customers will determine your position in the market and your eventual victory. But watch out for technical problems. Perhaps you will need the help of an agile vendor?

Introduction:
In the game Vendors players assume the roles of IT directors in large enterprises and strive to effectively develop their IT systems to attract and serve the greatest number of customers. To acquire new customers directors must choose from among - not always compatible - offers from various vendors and eal with the ensuing technical prolems. Whoever's company has the largest number of customers - both business and individual - at the end of the game wins.

Goal:
The goal of the game is to gain the most pairs of Customers (individual and business). At the end of the game, each pair of individual and business Customers gives 1 victory point. The winner is the player with the most points.

170881.name: Historia Aventurica
170881.description:
Publisher blurb

Die Geschichte Aventuriens ist überaus wechselhaft und spannend. Überall auf dem Kontinent kann man auf geheimnisvolle Spuren untergegangener Zivilisationen und vergessener Ereignisse stoßen - in den dampfenden Dschungeln Meridianas ebenso wie im ewigen Eis des hohen Nordens. Viele davon stammen aus Zeiten, in denen die Menschheit noch gar nicht existierte.
Doch auch Namen wie das Diamantene Sultanat, Alhanien oder Bosparan verheißen manches Mysterium. Selbst die jüngere Zeit war äußerst ereignisreich: Vom mysteriösen Verschwinden des Kaisers Hal über die Rückkehr Borbarads bis hin zu den Rückeroberung der Heptarchien – erstmals wird die wechselhafte Historie des Kontinents in einem Band zusammengefasst.

Viele Geheimnisse der vergangenen Zeitalter werden hier erstmals gelüftet, viele Geschehnisse der jüngeren Zeit erstmals miteinander verknüpft und durch übersichtliche Zeitleisten in ein anschauliches Verhältnis zueinander gesetzt.

Diese Spielhilfe enthält umfangreiche Zeitleisten durch die unterschiedlichen Zeitalter der Welt mit dem besonderen Fokus auf Aventurien, basierend auf den Angaben in den einzelnen Regionalspielhilfen und dem Aventurischen Boten. Die Kenntnisse des Regelwerks sind bei der Lektüre nicht vonnöten.

rpgitemversion: Special Release Black Book Lulu casewrap version
170882.name: Yellow Dawn: The Age of Hastur (Second Edition 2.5)
170882.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Earth has been ravaged by viral pathogens, the death of billions observed by the orbital colonies and deep-space habitats that were largely unaffected by the Outbreak. Terrified of infection, nobody came to help. Less than 30 percent survived the first few weeks. Then came the 2nd Wave of infection, spreading steadily outwards from the impact points, and that was when the horror really began...

YELLOW DAWN: This book is crammed with everything you will need to create characters, run scenarios and experience horror and adventure in the fictional world of David J Rodger.

FEATURES: The Influence of Hastur; Medical theories on the Infection; Zombie surges; Comprehensive scavenging system; Computer hacking and drug abuse; Non-human characters; Enhancements through cyberware and bioware; Weaponry, equipment and armour; Complex political, corporate and quasi-religious tensions; Schools of Elemental Magick, occultism, demonology, and the alien horrors of the Outer Chaos – the Cthulhu Mythos.

170883.name: Cards Against Humanity: TableTop Pack
170883.description: This expansion for Cards Against Humanity is an Indiegogo reward for people who backed Season 3 of TableTop. Contains 3 Black Cards and 12 White Cards specific to the Geek and Sundry show, TableTop!

170884.name: Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris
videogamehonor: 2015 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
170884.description:
Crystal Dynamics is proud to announce Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris, the sequel to the critically acclaimed Lara Croft and the Guardian of Light. This all-new adventure takes place in the Temple of Osiris, hidden deep in the deserts of Egypt. Lara Croft arrives at the temple, hoping to be the first inside, but rival treasure hunter Carter Bell has beaten her to the entrance. They each seek the Staff of Osiris, but they discover more than they bargained for.

Upon entering the tomb, Carter removes the mythical Staff from its resting place and inadvertently triggers a trap cursing them both and unleashing the evil god Set. But the staff also awakens the gods Horus and Isis, the son and wife of Osiris. Now free from their ancient prison, they join forces with Lara and Carter in order to resurrect Osiris, the only god capable of removing the curse.

As Lara and her companions fight their way across the sands and through ancient tombs, they will face gods and monsters of myth and legend. With the fate of the world at stake, Lara must uncover the fragments of Osiris to stop Set from enslaving all mankind.

Source: The Game Website.

170885.name: Ascension: Realms Unraveled
videogamehonor: 2014 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
170885.description:
User Summary

Ascension: Realms Unraveled is the seventh game in the series released for iOS. It is both a standalone game and an expansion that can be combined with any or all of the Ascension games.

Ascension: Realms Unraveled introduces three new mechanism:

- Dual Factions : Now some heroes belong to more than one faction
- Multi-Unite: This mechanism allow heroes from the same faction to combine and get different bonuses.
- Faction Based Transform: Some cards will change permanently when played with the correct faction, these cards don’t need energy to transform.

170887.description:
Main Event is a fun, easy to learn, player elimination, wrestling card game, for 2 to 5 players.

In Main Event, players place their character cards in a circle at the center of the table. This represents where their fighter is standing during the match. Players use cards to attack, dodge, block, and grapple, in an attempt to knock out their opponents. However this is often easier said than done.

Throughout the game, players will be moving around the ring dodging their foes attacks, all the while picking up weapons and gaining special abilities. And like any good Battle Royale, enemies will team up to take down a common foe, only to inevitably turn on each other.

So choose a fighter, grab a weapon, and KO your friends in an anything goes grudge match. LET'S GET READY TO SHUFFLE!
170887.name: Main Event: A Card Game Battle Royale
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 64 The Main Event
Episode 6: Xia: Legends of A Drift System, Far Space Foundry and Our Top 5 Games
TRCP Launch Episode 4

170888.name: Fortis Rex: Rise of the King
170888.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Fortis Rex is a High-Medieval Army Commanding RPG with supernatural elements. The game is totally non-linear and open world: go where you want when you want. Build your army, fight demonic enemies, and complete quests in a beautifully detailed and vibrant world. Fortis Rex is responsive to your actions: choose to do the right thing and reap the rewards of being good, choose the evil path and watch the game world react to your alignment”

Source: The Game Website.

170889.description:
ENGLISH
This game is set in the city of Barcelona, and it's based on the "Taxi Driver" comic by the illustrator and author Bié. It takes you into the world of the night shift of taxi drivers: your goal will be to take the highest number of passengers to their destinations. Learn languages to earn better tips from your customers, and improve your vehicle so you can carry more passengers. The driver who gets the highest revenues is the winner. Discover Barcelona in a different and thrilling way!

During his turn, a player can perform only ONE of the following actions. After that, his turn ends and the next player’s
turn starts. The possible actions are:
1. Look for Passengers (takes 2 passenger cards)
2. Improve language skills (place passenger card in a corner of driver card)
3. Take Passengers to a Destination (play cards of the hand to get a destination card)
4. Improve his vehicle (A player can improve his vehicle once
during the game by flipping his Driver card from side A to side B)


ESPAÑOL
Ambientada en la ciudad de Barcelona, y basado en el cómic “Taxi Driver” del ilustrador e historietista Bié, conviértete en un taxista del turno de noche con el objetivo de llevar al máximo número de pasajeros a sus destinos, aprende idiomas para lograr mejores propinas y mejora tu vehículo para llevar más clientes. El conductor que consiga la mayor recaudación será el ganador del juego. Descubre la ciudad condal de una forma divertida y distinta.



CATALÀ
Ambientada a la ciutat de Barcelona, i basat en el còmic "Taxi Driver" de l'il • lustrador i historietista Bié, converteix-te en un taxista del torn de nit amb l'objectiu de portar al màxim nombre de passatgers als seus destins, aprèn idiomes per aconseguir millors propines i millora el teu vehicle per portar més clients. El conductor que aconsegueixi la major recaptació serà el guanyador del joc. Descobreix la ciutat comtal d'una forma divertida i diferent.
170889.name: Taxi Driver Barcelona
boardgamepodcastepisode: DJ85: Taxi Driver Barcelona (2014) Javier Garcia

170891.name: Little farm
170891.description:
User Summary

In this casual puzzle game you have to collect vegetables from your farm by drawing squares in your field. You will collect all vegetables inside the square if the four corners have all the same vegetable.

170892.name: Panjwayi: Counterinsurgency in Afghanistan
170892.description:
Panjwayi: Counterinsurgency in Afghanistan is a FREE GAME. The content is available below as a .pdf, which includes rules, board, and pieces.

A professional version will be available on Game Crafter in the near future, link to follow.

Fight as Government of Afghanistan or the Taliban to control Panjwayi.

Panjwayi: Counterinsurgency in Afghanistan is a wargame unlike any you have ever played.

Panjwayi (pronounced PANZH-uh-way or panzh-way-EE) is a district of Kandahar Province, famous as the birthplace of the Taliban during the 1990s. 

After serious military defeats at the hands of NATO in 2006 and 2007, the Taliban are steadily reinforcing Panjwayi in the summer of 2008. No longer willing to stand up to NATO in set-piece battles which they know they will lose, the Taliban insurgents disguise themselves among the population, use Improvised Explosive Devices, and draw upon large numbers of expendable recruits arriving from Pakistan and elsewhere. Can the Taliban defeat the enormous technological edge held by the Government of Afghanistan (GoA) and their NATO Allies? Or can the GoA convince the wavering population to have faith in the new government, and set the conditions in Panjwayi for stability to take hold for the first time in a generation?

Choose either side, and use your unique strengths against your opponent's weaknesses to determine who will win control of the symbolic home of the Taliban.

Designed by a soldier who fought there, Panjwayi is easy to learn, quick to play, and hard to master. Using elegant abstraction to simplify complex military operations, Panjwayi captures the frustration and feel of the deadly summer of 2008.
As the Taliban say of their enemies, "You have the watches, we have the time."

170893.name: KASAKASA!
170893.description: In KASAKASA!, players control cockroaches, trying to best infest a house. This game was released at the Fall 2014 Tokyo Game Market.

170894.name: Hideous Creatures: Rat-Things
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Nominee
2015 ENnie for Best Electronic Book - Silver Winner
170894.description:
publisher blurb

“Witnesses said it had long hair and the shape of a rat, but that its sharp-toothed, bearded face was evilly human while its paws were like tiny human hands.” Witch become rat, or thing become hyper-physicist? Familiar-ize yourself with Lovecraft’s creepiest creation.

Hideous Creatures: Rat-Things is the tenth installment of the second Ken Writes About Stuff subscription available to subscribers now – it will be available to buy in the webstore in January. If you have subscribed to the second KWAS subscription, Hideous Creatures: Rat-Things is now on your order receipt page, so all you have to do is click on the new link in your order email. (If you can’t find your receipt email, you can get another one sent to you by entering your email address here).

170896.name: A Bird Story
170896.description:
User Summary

A short, 1-hour interactive story from Freebird Games, creator of To the Moon which serves as a teaser for To the Moon's upcoming sequel Finding Paradise.

A Bird Story blends a child's imagination with everyday monotony when a young boy befriends an injured bird and takes him in.

170897.name: Schnutenbach: Der Zirkus des Schreckens
170897.description:
user summary

An adventure book for the Schnutenbach setting.

It contains the following four adventures:
Die Mission des Magiers (The Mission of the Mage)
Das Grab des Gruftkönigs (The grave of the Tomb King)
Der Zirkus des Schreckens (The Circus of Horror)
Das Gasthaus am Galgenbaum (The Tavern near the Gibbet)

170898.name: Schnutenbach: Dunkles Vermächtnis
170898.description:
user summary

A short adventure for the Schnutenbach setting.

170900.name: Sneaky Statues of Easter Island
170900.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Help to solve one of the greatest mysteries in history!

In Sneaky Statues of Easter Island, players take turns moving eight "stone" Moai statues. Where do they move? How do they end up in a straight line? That's up to you!

Be the first to outwit your rival and arrange your four mysterious statues together in a straight line and win. But wait! Your rival knows which statue you will move next. The question is...does he know where it will go?

170901.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In the long winters between raiding seasons, warriors keep their intellect sharp through games of wits and chance. Ragnar, Rollo, Floki and even the Earl challenge each other to this game of stone placement filled with tactics and subtle maneuvering for victory.

In Jarl: The Vikings Tile-Laying Game, players move their warriors (tiles) around the board and flip them over after each move. Each tile's side shows a different movement profile. If you end your movement in a square occupied by an opponent's tile, you capture that tile. Capture your opponent's Jarl to win!
170901.name: Jarl: The Vikings Tile-Laying Game

170902.name: Orion: Prelude
170902.description:
Orion is a fast-paced, first person shooter with a heavy emphasis on team-based, multiplayer play. The game itself is set on an alien world that is similar in nearly every way to our earth in prehistoric times. The development of this game gives us as a team the wonderful opportunity to focus on what we view as the core of action genre game play.

Source: The Publisher Website.

170904.name: Might and Magic Heroes VI: Shades of Darkness
170904.description:
The stand-alone expansion, named Might & Magic Heroes VI: Shades of Darkness, was released on May 13, 2013. Unlike the original game and its DLC, Shades of Darkness was developed by Virtuos. Its main protagonist is the Dark Elf Raelag, who first appeared in Heroes of Might and Magic V, and features the return of the Dungeon faction, led by the Dark Elves. New additional content is also available, such as about 20 new neutral creatures, 10 new buildings and three new artifact sets. There are also expected to be notable changes to the multiplayer wing, especially the way players connect to the Conflux and a redesigned Legacy weapons system.

Source: Wikipedia, "Might & Magic Heroes VI", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

170905.name: Might and Magic Heroes VI - Pirates of the Savage Sea Adventure Pack
videogamecompilation: Might and Magic Heroes VI Gold Edition
170905.description:
User Summary

Pirates of the Savage Seais a downloadable adventure pack expanding Might & Magic Heroes VI. It includes a new hero named Crag Hack and a new scenario, in which Crag Hack is recruited to discover what is happening to ships in the Savage Sea. It also includes new artifacts, as well as new features for Might & Magic Heroes VI, such as town screens.

170906.name: Might and Magic Heroes VI - Danse Macabre Adventure Pack
videogamecompilation: Might and Magic Heroes VI Gold Edition
170906.description:
User Summary

The second adventure pack for Might and Magic Heroes VI, Danse Macabre adds more heroes, more artifacts, a unique building, and a new scenario to play through featuring Sandro, the necromancer, who is accused of treason by Belketh and the Spider Cult.

170907.description:
This scenario was released by Portal games for Christmas 2014. It was designed specifically to be played with children/family. Ignacy's daughter helped develop this scenario.

From the scenario description:

"You have acquired a damaged map. It seems to be leading to a pirate's treasure. You decide to hire Nick, an old sea dog, who will take you to the island shown on the map. Just be aware that he will not, however, work for free, so you have to try and find as many treasures as possible."
170907.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island – Treasure Island Junior
boardgameexpansion: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
boardgamefamily: Robinson Crusoe: Adventure on the Cursed Island

170908.name: The Marvellous Miss Take
170908.description:
User Summary

In this stealth game, you control Sophia Take whose fortune in art and artifacts has been stolen. She only wants to get it back. Avoid guards by distracting them in many different ways in order to retrieve your treasures.

There are a couple of unique twists to the stealth genre. First, the guards do not follow set paths. You can't just lie in wait until the opportune time. You will need to be proactive. Second, observers in the levels will go get the guards if you are seen retrieving goods.

170909.description:
In a distant future, tiranic megacorporations haunt the galaxy.

Gigantic lab creatures serve as weapons on planets at peace.

Theres an excelent oportunity for certain corporations and people to gain power and influence becoming the next Galaxy Hunter.

Caçadores da Galáxia (Galaxy Hunters) is a euro game of Work and Tile placement about war on distant planets, mech building and resource management.

You dock your workers into the planets to gather resources and buy equipment (tiles) to build a better Mech. Once you have weapons and better armor you are fit to combat and can dock your Mech on invaded planets with monsters to engage in a deterministic combat.

Once you kill these monsters you gain victory points and also rewards to acquire missions and better gear.
170909.name: Caçadores da Galáxia

170910.name: Simcity Buildit
170910.description:
We’re glad to have you on board. Your first order of business – build your own gorgeous city that has citizens vying to move in. The larger your city gets, the more needs your citizens have. Solve challenges and add Services to keep them happy and your city thriving.


Build a unique city that comes to life
Unleash natural (and not so natural) disasters
Create and trade goods with your friends and other cities
Balance city Services, including power and entertainment, to keep citizens happy
Pinch, zoom, and rotate 360 degrees as you manage your city on the go – both online and offline
Complete awesome challenges to Specialize your city


Source: The Publisher Website.

170911.name: Vertexor (ICONS)
170911.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the release of Assembled Edition, ICONS is back and better than ever.

Worlds Most Wanted helps you get to the fun faster with pregenerated villains, adventure hooks and maps.

Vertexor is a possessed action figure and supervillain for hire. Don't let his 8 inch height fool you; he compensates with his penchant for violence, extreme firepower and complete lack of morals.

170912.name: Ajax
170912.description:
From publisher blurb:

Meet AJAX!!

Never-before-available in any format! The newest release from Les Supérieurs corner in the WatchGuard Universe! Born with Red-K based powers from his drug-addicted mother, Keegan Ball uses the morals and values instilled in him by his adoptive parents to fight for justice alongside Canada's premiere metahuman team of heroes, Les Supérieurs!!

170913.name: Rōgun Holiday Special
170913.description:
From publisher blurb:

The “Holiday Special” is a time-honored tradition for television series, especially those that aired during the groovy seventies!

So, what exactly did these Specials entail?

It usually varied from show to show, but they usually had one common trait: they were heavy-handed in their messages of kindness, togetherness and any other feel-good emotions ending in “ness”. They were also almost universally cheesier than a deep pan pizza!

That’s what this particular PDF is all about. It offers a ready-to-run Holiday Special for the series found in the Retrostar Lightspeed Adventure Manual PDF. You will need the L.A.M. in order to use this Episode. It can be downloaded at the same place that you downloaded this PDF from... and it’s free as well.

Here’s to a happy holiday season from all of us at Spectrum Games!

170914.name: Fairground
170914.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 30 inch Battlemap of a Fairground, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“Welcome to the fair. Enjoy the rides, races, games, shows, and food!”

Fairground is an external map of an amusement park or state fair. Interiors are provided for half the park’s features except for a few tents and the helter skelter or skyslide ride.

Fairground is intended for pulp, horror, or modern games. Fairground was made to be a companion to our Big Top adventure and map.

Fairground has good scope as it can be used as part of a state fair or as a part of an amusement park.

170915.name: The Opened Mind
170915.description:
From publisher blurb:


It was supposed to be a simple caravan ride...

Explore the mysteries of Jace’s Stanchion and the secrets hidden in it while also getting introduced to psionics and learning how the psionic classes work!

This adventure is designed for up to four 1st level characters to introduce them to the psionic system. Set in the remote town of Jace’s Stanchion, the characters will need to explore the town to learn more about the unusual events that have been occurring within its borders and the forests outside.

Included are four sample characters to create a ready-to-use, all-psionic party using the races and classes found in Ultimate Psionics.

"The Opened Mind" includes:

The adventure set in Jace’s Stanchion
A bestiary section detailing the new monster found outside the town’s walls
An appendix of psionic items found in the adventure
A gazeteer of information about Jace’s Stanchion, as well as a map of the town
Four sample characters, including a cryptic, psion, soulknife, and vitalist

170916.name: Mundane No More: Texts and Tomes 3 - Psionic Repositories
rpgseries: Mundane No More: Texts and Tomes
170916.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mundane No More: Texts and Tomes 3, Psionic Repositories, by author Rich Howard, presents several new psionic-themed texts and tomes in item format (crystals and gems), as structured from his previous release Mundane No More: Texts and Tomes--detailed below. Psionic Repositories uses the psionic rules for Pathfinder as available from Dreamscarred Press's Ultimate Psionics.

Words. We love them. We’re gamers, after all. From novels to rule sets to textbooks to cereal boxes, non-magical language is the foundation of our imaginations. So why is it that PCs rifle through libraries in search of spellbooks and magical manuals while leaving generations of carefully cultivated knowledge strewn under their muddy boots?

Mundane No More: Texts and Tomes, remedies this by turning fantasy (and modern) libraries into treasure troves of knowledge. Mundane texts provide opportunities for any literate member of an adventuring party to retrain unwanted feats, refocus their skill ranks into areas helpful to the campaign, and to gain rare and exotic recipes for poisons, inventions, and, yes, even magic items.

Game Masters can use mundane texts to introduce plot twists, foreshadow events, patch holes in a party’s skills, and provide characters with the knowledge to confront enemies to come.

Within the pages of Mundane No More: Texts and Tomes you'll find:

A four-tier ranking system that describes the knowledge each text contains and how your characters can benefit from it.
A system for using tomes to retrain your character's skills, feats, spells and more, compatible with the retraining rules found in Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Ultimate Campaign.
Detailed crafting-recipe rules that encourage characters to research the creation of mundane tools and weapons, alchemical preparations, and magical items as opposed to "knowing it all" with a single skill rank
Creation rules for mundane texts.
A dozen pre-built tomes and manuals of all types and tiers ready to drop into your campaign right now.




Don't wait, pick up a copy and add the power of the written word to your character’s arsenal!

170917.description:
Super Fantasy Rumble is a tactical skirmish card game with a puzzle-like Battle mechanic. Your goal is to lead your randomly drawn Rumble Fighters to eliminate all your Opponent's Rumble Fighters. The Rumble Fighters and art style is inspired by 80s Saturday Morning Cartoons and video games that we all love.

Players receives six Rumble Fighters - two powerful leaders and four warriors via draft or random draw. Each Rumble Fighter has a health value, an attack value, a defense value, special abilities, and varied Action Points that indicate which directions they can attack and defend.

Each Player places six Rumble Fighters onto a four-by-four grid and then uses your turns doing movements and attacks. Each turn, you have three movements to move your Rumble Fighters into the best position to attack: Dash, Castle, and Slide. When you Dash, you move a single character to an adjacent space. When you Castle, you can exchange two of your adjacent fighters. When you slide, you can move an entire row or column of fighter in either direction.

Positioning is the main component of the game. How can I position my Rumble Fighters in the best possible way to eliminate all my Opponent's fighter and win the game?
170917.name: Super Fantasy Rumble
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 56: Assaulting Settlers?

170918.name: 'Tis the Season to be Bloody
170918.description:
From publisher blurb:

You'd better watch out, you'd better not die, there's no doubt, I'm telling you why... Santy and Missy Towe are coming to town! While that may not have a great rhythm to it, such trivialities won't matter much once the blood starts flowing.

This PDF mini-supplement offers:

Advice for creating and running Christmas-themed flicks
Write-ups for a tandem of particularly deranged psycho killers: Santy and Missy Towe.
A seed for a flick featuring the aforementioned killers, wherein the victims are trapped in a department store after hours on Christmas Eve while Santy and Missy hunt them down.

170919.name: Mythic Wondrous Items Volume I
170919.description:
From publisher blurb:

So you’ve picked out your mythic path, chosen your path abilities, learned a few mythic spells, and given yourself a mythic feat or two, but there’s one key aspect of character customization that you’re missing: magic items. Adventurers are only as good as the tools that they use, and why should mythic characters have to settle for the same every-day magic items that lesser mortals use?

This book presents mythic versions of twenty six iconic wondrous items. These superior versions of well-known favorites are bigger, flashier, and more powerful, with expanded abilities suitable for a mythic campaign. Even further, each of them has a special ability that interacts in some specific way with mythic power, allowing mythic characters to make the most of their abilities.

170920.name: Deathball
170920.description:
Deathball is a fast paced and brutal sports game inspired by others such as Dreadball and Blood Bowl. Challenge your friends in a match of this violent sports contest where a well-placed pass is just as important as a well-placed punch.

Deathball is a single-page ruleset played with Warhammer 40,000 and Warhammer Fantasy, miniatures that was designed to be fast to learn and simple to play.

Inspired by Blood Bowl and other sports games the system pits you and your friends in a fast paced competition of violently hilarious ball play.

The game is played in turns, where during each turn the coaches activate their players. Once a coach has finished activating all of his players once or has failed an activation play passes to the other coach.

170921.name: Grimdark Racing
170921.description:
Grimdark Racing is an action packed and explosive game inspired by video-games like Mario Kart and Crash Team Racing. Up to 8 players take part in a deadly race full of items, hazards and crazy tracks to see who is the king of the road.

Grimdark Racing is a single-page ruleset played with Warhammer 40.000 miniatures that was designed to be fast to learn and simple to play.

The system allows you to challenge your friends in an explosive race full of crazy gadgets and hilarious accidents waiting to happen around the very next corner.

We recommend going all out with this! Create an awesome track littered with hazards and made of many twists, turns, jumps, etc. We also recommend taking some time and converting your vehicles into mad racers full of personality!

170922.description:
You're all bandits trying to rob this boomtown blind! Take down the bank, train, stagecoach, and even the brothel in this frantic and fun real-time dice shoot em' up!

In Boomtown Bandits, players take turns placing two shooter tokens and a coward token around the town — face down to hide your coward's identity! All the tokens are then revealed.

A Wild West "draw" occurs whenever any competing bandits try and rob the same location. This shootout is in the form of simultaneous dice rolling (with players rolling as many corresponding dice as they allocated tokens), and rolling is continuous until there's a hit or until a coward runs!

Locations include seven loot cards, each with strategic weapons and abilities to help you in future fights. When any location is out of cards the game ends, bonuses are awarded and the bandit with the most loot wins! Who will rob the most money and be the baddest bandit of them all?
170922.name: Boomtown Bandits
boardgameexpansion: Boomtown Bandits: Sneakiest Bastard Promo Card
boardgamepodcastepisode: MOBG podcast 39 This is the Real Deal, Part 2 of Spiel Essen
Vox Republica 122: Roll For Self-Care

170923.description:
Colonial Space Wars: Flesh and Steel is an expansion for the sci-fi wargame Colonial Space Wars: New Horizons.

Several new units, skills and missions are now available for this strategic game without dice.

Each player takes the role of one Commander, leading his army and challenging others in a desperate massive ground battle. Only a leader that excels in strategic planning, military tactics and resource management will prevail.
170923.name: Colonial Space Wars: Flesh and Steel

170926.name: The Mage's Tower
170926.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep in the forest, away from prying eyes, the Mage is free to study the Arcane and the Ancient. Who knows what secrets are held within the Mage's Tower?

The Mage's Tower is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Haunted Mansion is a multiple level set, comprising 7 battlemaps (each depicting a different floor)

Ground Floor - Winter forests surrounds the lower level of the tower. Inside the entrance hall is a throne and wide sweeping stairs
1st Floor - This balcony level features 5 mysterious statues arranged around the walls, Made of different stones, do they hold a secret?
2nd Floor - The Mage's Bedchamber. Reaced by a set of spiral stairs, this level features a warm bedchamber with an exterior balcony area.
3rd Floor - The Study. A table with an inlaid map is covered in scrolls and books, whilst the surrounding walls are lined with ancient tomes.
4th Floor - The Palantir. The room is filled with magical light from the Crystal Seeing Ball on a plinth. 4 Chests are also present - what do they contain? Are they linked to the statues on the 1st floor?
5th Floor - The Spellcasting Floor. This large dark chamber glows with the remnants of spell casting circles and magical symbols.
6th Floor - The roof. Decorated with a brass dome in the centre, the roof is the ideal location for a final showdown with a rogue Sorcerer.




Also included is a set of 300dpi full size jpgs, for poster printing or VTT.

170927.name: Kortslutning
170927.description: In this Swedish, fast-paced quiz, players must answer simple yes or no questions - but with the mirrored truth.

170928.name: Five Armies
170928.description:
5 player pvp free print & play generic fantasy wargame by Neontek. In Five Armies, five kings compete to dominate the battlefield during twelve rounds of dice rolling combat. Uploaded to BGG as a 2014 Christmas gift for the community. (Includes original game map, 18 cards, and rulebook in the files section.)

Gameplay summary: Player versus player, so alliances are possible, but not mandatory. The game ends after 12 rounds. Each round, someone draws the event card. This card influences gameplay and turn order. Players move their orc, goblin, dwarf, elf, or human army across the map to attack opponents. Players win victory points by dominating the most terrain per round.

170929.name: Crossy Magnetic
170929.description: Crossy magnetic is a word game in which two to four players score points by placing tiles, each bearing a single letter, onto a gameboard. The tiles must form words which, in crossword fashion, flow left to right in rows or downwards in columns. The words must be defined in a standard dictionary.

170930.name: Europolis orase din romania
170930.description: Europolis orase din romania is a Monopoly-like game where you can make real estate transactions in various cities: you can buy land, villas and hotels that brings rental income or you can become the owner of roads or utilities which also enable you to gain.

170931.name: Europolis Global
170931.description:
A game that continues the series EUROPOLIS;
A variation of Monopoly. The game enables you to make real estate transactions: buy land,villas and hotels that bring rent income or you can own airlines and utilities (water and electricity), also reliable fund resources.
In Europolis global you can become the owner of global airlines or resources. To win the game you have to become the richest and other players to bankruptcy. Through a new graphical presentation of the board, now more realistic, the game contributes to the development of geographical skills.

170932.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

World War II began when the German battleship Schleswig-Holstein opened fire in the early morning hours of 1 September 1939. The war started on the Baltic Sea, and some of its very last actions took place there as well.

Sea of Iron is a complete Second World War at Sea boxed game based on actions on the Baltic Sea between 1939 and 1945. Thirty-six scenarios track the operations and battles that took place or could have taken place between the fleets and air forces of Germany, Poland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, the Soviet Union, Finland and Sweden. In addition to their complete Baltic Sea orders of battle, the Soviets, Swedes and Finns all have additional ships they planned or began to construct but did not complete. And of course the game includes scenarios for their use.

There are 140 “long” ship pieces and 420 standard-sized square ones representing smaller warships, transports, aircraft (many, many aircraft) and a handful of markers. This is a big game, at least in terms of pieces. The map is not so big: the Baltic Sea is pretty small and almost completely land-locked, with ports and airfields in abundance. Aircraft are very potent in this theater, and ships have very little room to hide. The map by Guy Riessen shows the full Baltic on a single 11x17-inch panel.

The scenarios cover all of the action from the Polish “Operation Peking” in which three destroyers escaped to England just before the war began, to the planned Swedish invasion of German-held Denmark in May 1945.
170932.name: Second World War at Sea: Sea of Iron
boardgameexpansion: Second World War at Sea: Plan Z

170933.name: APOC-X
170933.description:
Summary written by developer for VGG

APOC-X is a top down dual stick tactical and action shooter with 3 game modes:

ARCADE: Non-linear sandbox like levels where you have to find your way out, action, adventure, exploration, secret areas and puzzles also included in the level design. This game mode was inspired by classic games like the Gauntlet or Alien Breed.

TACTICAL: If one marine is not enough take control of an entire squad. Slow paced tactical mode, where the player controls one marine at a time while the rest of the team is in overwatch mode. Take part in the action and plan the tactical movement of your team. This game mode vas inspired by Space Crusade (Space Quest) and Space Hulk - it is just real time, with more action.

ARENA: Arena mode for those who love it!

170934.name: Spel van het jaar 2008
170934.description: Very basic quiz games with question regarding trivia of 2008. It uses a similar system to Trivial Pursuit but is done solely by cards and chips.

170937.name: Newton
170937.description:
A quiz game based on a norwegian TV science show for youths, where all the players get the same 8 questions. Every question have 4 alternative where 1, 2, or 3 answers are right. Each player choose the alternatives they think is right by choosing the right "answering tokens". If you have one or more wrong you get no points but if you got all right you got points depending on how many answers was correct.

The one with most points after the last question is asked is the winner.

170938.name: The Twelve Monsters of Christmas
170938.description:
user summary

A Holiday Celebration for Monsters and Other Childish Things!

A collection of twelve monsters for use with Monsters and Other Childish Things.

170939.description:
Backers of the Indiegogo project for Assault on Doomrock received the following Promo Pack of 8 cards:

Common Items:

Stoneskin Potion (2 Copies)
- Artifact. Consumable. -
Consume during roll phase: Gain 4 Shield tokens.

Black Hole Potion (2 Copies)
- Artifact. Consumable. -
Consume: Move all characters from up to two groups to a new group.

Hammer of Doom
- Weapon. 2-Hand. -
Use: +1 damage to one of the targets of an attack.
Use: Ignore 1 armor during a melee attack.
Requires: 1 Str

Uncomfortable Armor
- Armor. -
Gain an expose marker at the start of round.
Use: Push yourself.

Epic Items:

Bloodstone Necklace
- Artifact. -
Use: When a hero suffers HP loss, you suffer all of that HP loss instead and gain 1 Heroism token.

Ear Necklace
- Artifact. -
Whenever a hero is reduced to or below 1 HP, gain a secret marker on this item.
Use: Spend all secret markers from this card to gain twice that many heroism markers.
Requires: 1 Agi, 1 Str
170939.name: Assault on Doomrock: Indiegogo Promo Pack

170940.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Europe is ablaze with the final conflicts of World War Two. As the Allies are caught unaware by a German assault in the misty Ardennes forests, the Black Sun unleashes mythos evil from ancient sites, hoping to overwhelm the Allies forces, whilst the Nachtwolfe attempt to power up a vast war machine that will bring about a thousand-year Reich. All the while the dreams of Cthulhu inspire cultists to rise up in preparation for his return!

As the heroes of Section M and Majestic in Achtung! Cthulhu: The Secret War, you must race across Europe on vital missions facing ancient terrors, recovering strange artifacts, and learning unspeakable knowledge to help defeat the forces of the Third Reich and the Cultists of the Old Gods. To aid the heroes' desperate endeavors, the players must learn to command the powerful but over-extended Allied forces to help halt the tide of evil!
170940.name: Achtung! Cthulhu: The Secret War
boardgamepodcastepisode: 39: Boardgame Cthulhu

170945.name: Dust Tactics: Axis 2014 Forces Deck
170945.description:
These decks contain a card for every Axis model available for Dust Tactics released before January 2014, and include cards for the D-48 premium range.

Each card decks contain 100 full colour stat cards to make your force compatible with the new edition of Dust Tactics!

A copy of the Dust Tactics rulebook is necessary to use the contents of these card decks.

170946.name: Dust Tactics: Allies 2014 Forces Deck
170946.description:
These decks contain a card for every Allied model available for Dust Tactics released before January 2014, and include cards for the D-48 premium range.

Each card decks contain 100 full colour stat cards to make your force compatible with the new edition of Dust Tactics!

A copy of the Dust Tactics rulebook is necessary to use the contents of these card decks.

170947.name: Dust Tactics: SSU 2014 Forces Deck
170947.description:
These decks contain a card for every SSU model available for Dust Tactics released before January 2014, and include cards for the D-48 premium range.

Each card decks contain 100 full colour stat cards to make your force compatible with the new edition of Dust Tactics!

A copy of the Dust Tactics rulebook is necessary to use the contents of these card decks.

170948.name: Naginata
170948.description:
Naginata is a direct confrontation between 2 samurai who clash in a Dojo. Both of them will try to reduce their opponent's life points to zero (0) to defeat them and win the game!

Both players will firstly choose a Weapon to be their Starting Weapon. There are 3 Weapons available: Wakizashi, a light knife; Katana, a dangerous sword; and Naginata, a heavy halberd. Their choice is crucial to their strategy!

Then, in each turn, both players will receive 3 Action cards. Action cards show 2 different actions in their opposite sides, so players will have to choose the action they want to use while losing the other one during that turn.
Actions include Attack, Parry, Move and Unsheath. Attack allows players to damage their opponent. Parry cancels an opponent's Attack if played in front of it, and also applies a penalty to the opponent in that case. Move allows players to move their Samurai token on the Dojo (board). Unsheath allows players to change their active Weapon.

Both players will prepare their turn strategy simultaneously setting their 3 Action cards in the selected way, and then they will reveal their chosen actions one by one. When all 3 actions have been solved, if no player has their life track on zero (0) or below, the game continues. Players add the numbers in their actions to place the Reiki and Hearth tokens, which have special effects on the Dojo, and just start a brand new turn!

When a Samurai is defeated, having their life on zero (0) or below, the game ends! The Samurai who is still alive is the winner. Several games can be played in a row adding punctuations to enjoy a more complete experience.

170949.name: Die Burg der Ungeheuer
170949.description:
User description

This adventure was only available at Spiel 1984 to accompany the launch of the first edition of Das Schwarze Auge.

The Subtitle reads:
Spezialabenteuer für die Deutschen Spieletage '84
(Special adventure for the German Gaming Days '84)

170950.name: Playa Playa
170950.description:
Quickly, the coast is in danger! A lot of waste has been abandoned on the beach and there is a risk they are being swept away by the waves.
Find the hidden marine animals from the garbage and move the waste in the correct bins before the sea rises!

In his turn player rolls the die and acts accordingly:
If it shows "animal" - the player turns around a waste tile.
If the same type of animal is under that tile player may trash the waste. If not He puts the tile back on the board.
If it shows "trach can" - the player may trash any tile from the board.
If it shows "waves" - the sea rises a little bit.

If the players find all the animals under the waste they win together.
If the sea level rises so much that the waste pollutes the sea then the players lose.

170951.description:
Incited by the economic and political interests of the bourgeoisie, a liberal regime of monarchy was constituted in Belgium on 1830 gaining the independence from the United Kingdom of the Netherlands.

The Congress of the new fragile Kingdom called the German Prince Leopold of Saxe Coburg and Saafeld to occupy the Throne: the first Belgian King, Leopold I, took office in the 1831. The new foreign King must solve many problems starting from the industrialization of a rural Country divided by different political and religious groups.

In The Foreign King, players take on the roles of influential Belgian bourgeoisie and who industrialize Belgian provinces, build metallurgical and textile factories in order to obtain greater economic power, vote in the National Congress seeking to increase their political influence, expand its social mass and send to the provinces under their dominion at the highest authority, King Leopold I of Belgium, to revise the provinces in the pursuit of their own interests.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game will win the game.
170951.name: The Foreign King
boardgameexpansion: The Foreign King: Railroad / Catholic Against Liberals

170953.name: A Touch of Evil: Krampus
boardgameexpansion: A Touch of Evil: The Supernatural Game
170953.description:
Much of the folklore that the original settlers of Shadowbrook practiced in the old world also made the journey across the ocean. One such tale is that of Krampus, the Holiday Devil. Krampus is said to wander the countryside one night a year, punishing naughty children that fail to do their chores by whipping them with rods of birch. Those that he deems especially naughty, he throws in his old sack to be taken back to his lair.. and eaten! Of course, all folklore has its roots somewhere in fact.

Krampus is the fourth web villain for A Touch of Evil, released for Christmas 2014 as a free print & play expansion.

170954.name: Stinky Pig Game
170954.description: You press the pigs belly and he sings. While he sings you roll a dice that tells you how to pass the pig. The person holding the pig when he farts and the music stops, gets a token. The person with the fewest tokens at the end wins.

170955.name: Monopoly: University of Kent
170955.description: Based on one of the UK's leading academic institutions, the University of Kent at Canterbury, known as the UK's European University.

boardgameintegration: The Red Dragon's Lair 2: Pharaoh's Tomb
The Red Dragon's Lair 2: Pharaoh's Tomb
170956.description:
Robin Hood the Rogue is a 36 card expansion character for The Red Dragon's Lair Adventure Card Game.

Robin Hood can hide and attack enemies from the shadows!
Exclusive The Game Crafter Edition Card Backs!

This expansion set includes a single Character Deck, plus components to add a brand new character to your game.
170956.name: The Red Dragon's Lair: Robin Hood the Rogue – Expansion Character

170959.description:
This expansion marks the second fully cooperative adventure for Descent Second Edition. In traditional games of Descent, one player is the overlord, controlling deadly monsters and springing traps, while up to four players battle these monsters, gathering items and experience as they move through the campaign.

Cooperative adventures like Nature’s Ire change this gameplay entirely by allowing up to four players to work together to defeat monsters and traps controlled by the game. Each cooperative adventure simulates a mini campaign in one session, inviting you to explore an expanding area, testing your wits, battling monsters, and grabbing loot and experience along the way!

In the Nature’s Ire cooperative adventure, you and your friends investigate the disappearance of the population of Blue Rock village. Accompanied by a single survivor, you must venture beneath the boughs of a foreboding forest, battling deadly foes and the forces of nature to save the missing villagers from a most gruesome fate. As you move through the adventure, new encounters and areas are revealed from a randomized Exploration deck, meaning you’ll never face the same adventure twice!

Note: The rules for the Nature’s Ire expansion are not included in the box. The rules are available for free download from the Fantasy Flight Descent: Journeys in the Dark Second Edition support page.
170959.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition) – Nature's Ire
boardgameexpansion: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)

170960.description:
Description from the publisher:

Add more players and character options to your Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous Base Set with the Wrath of the Righteous – Character Add-On Deck. Inside this 110-card deck you'll find four additional Pathfinder Adventure Card Game characters, including three all-new classes — bloodrager, hunter, and shaman — along with all the cards you need to expand your adventures to five or six players. New monsters, items, and more give you everything you need to face even the most mythic challenges.
170960.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Character Add-On Deck
boardgameexpansion: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Character Mats
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Wrath of the Righteous – Base Set

170961.name: Castle Dice: More Castles! – Kickstarter Stretch Goal Rewards
170961.description:
These items were unlocked as part of Castle Dice: More Castles! stretch goals. They will not be included in the retail version

Super Scout (x4)
All 4 cards are the same.
Text says: Play after you gather an animal. Add any card from your Castle deck discard pile to your hand.
Note: One Super Scout can be added to each of the Castle Decks in play.

Super Villagers (x4)
4 different cards (Super Farmer, Super Worker, Super Guard, and Super Merchant)
Note: These will be totally optional to use. You can choose to put the matching one into your Castle Deck or not. And if you do put them in your deck, you can choose to remove any one other card from the deck before the game starts (or not, again it’s up to you). In fact, if you use card sleeves, your group could even put these into your Village deck for variety!

170962.name: UDT-68 submarine base
170962.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover a mystery of UDT-68 submarine base - a secret facility located on a remote island at Barents sea .

If you would like to know:

Why Nazis have decided to build the submarine base there?
What secrets are buried beneath old stone circle located on an island?
What treat to our civilization could be awaken there?




UDT-68 submarine base provides an excellent starting point for GM to make an interesting game set in WWII (or weird war). It consists of GM’s notebook as well as stylized handouts which can be printed and presented to players

Please note that the supplement is stat free and can be used in any WWII game.

The supplement consists of two sections:

Documentation (GM section):
Submarine base map (two levels);
Island map (one level);
Location map;

Intel files ( Players handouts):
Briefing files;
Intel maps,





Please note that Intel files are sometimes slightly different than material for GM. This is not a mistake - simply secret service couldn't get accurate data.

170963.name: Poisoning of the Elba River
170963.description:
From publisher blurb:

FQ2- Poisoning of the Elba River is the second offering for the Filbar Quest Series. Your group of adventurers has come together from a successful adventure in the old ruins seeking more fame and glory. As they travel they come upon the small community of Kamortha. Recently a problem occurred when the Witch of Margrove Swamp cursed the community as she left. Now the people have developed some strange facial malady and they want a cure. Can your party of adventurers discover the secret of the plague and resolve it for the fine people of Kamortha?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for an initial party of adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

170964.name: Project Demna
170964.description:
From publisher blurb:


"Demna Is Coming. Demna Is Coming to You."

In the world of the Earth of 2018, there are many people awakening to discover that they have tremendous powers of the mind. These people can suddenly read minds, manipulate mass without physical contact, even control the actions of others or cause spontaneous fires. This awakening can be a terrifying thing, both for those who discover they have a new ability and for those around them.

Not only is this awakening a frightening event, it automatically makes the new Psionicist a target; evil Corporations, Government agencies, even supervillains and aliens will be hunting them down and trying to take them for experimentation or reprogramming. They may find themselves forced to act as soldiers, spies, and/or assassins, or worse, be ground up into genetic material to make OTHER people into nigh-mindless slaves with near-limitless power.

Fortunately for these people, there is Project Demna; a world-wide organization that locates new Psionicists, trains them, and gives them a chance to live the life they choose for themselves. Many of them become operatives of Project Demna to repay the moral debt. Project Demna breaks up illegal Psionic recruitment and experimentation, assists law enforcement when incredible powers of the mind turn to criminal activity, and lobbies governments for laws and regulations to protect those who have Psionic ability. It all seems almost too good to be true.

Those who dig too deep into Project Demna, though, discover criminal financial practices and teams of assassins. Worse still, there's a vast, world-ending threat heading for the Earth, and Project Demna may be the only thing that has a chance to stop it, or even to just slow it down.

They are the protectors of those who awaken to power. They are the eyes and ears of the Destiny Council. They are the shadowy figures at the back of the halls of power and the perpetrators of some of the largest financial crimes in history. They are mankind's last hope against a ravenous space monster. They are Project Demna.

170966.name: More Grand Hallways
170966.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Grand Hallways features new 30-foot wide hallways, which align with, but won't exactly match, other hallways. It includes transition tiles between these over-sized halls and other styles.

The Dungeons in Blue series brings classic blue maps to the virtual tabletop! These ready-to-fill maps are packed with rooms, corridors, pits, and caves; all judiciously sprinkled with tricks and traps. Every geomorph tile seamlessly connects to every other tile in the series, providing the megadungeon builder tremendous freedom and flexibility.

This product includes twenty-four unique map tiles rendered at 100px per five-foot square. All geomorphs in this set are passage heavy, so rooms are scarce. Don't worry, there are still plenty of interesting spaces within! The set includes two versions of each tile, one for players and one for GMs. The GM's version shows additional features, tricks, and traps. This set includes (GH25-GH48):

Twelve 50x50 foot tiles.
Twelve 50x100 foot tiles.
A map legend image detailing all map markup.
A one-third scale summary map showing all tiles.
A short readme PDF.




All maps are ready-to-use PNG-format files compatible with most virtual tabletops. Use them as-is, or combine them into larger maps using your favorite image processing software.

170967.name: A Flirtation with Fey
170967.description:
From publisher blurb:

A simple scribe vanishes from his shop during a suspicious fire, leaving the heroes—the only people he can trust—hints as to his whereabouts. The heroes must collect clues, unmask spies, and infiltrate an exclusive party to find the missing scribe. These clues reveal a murderous plot stretching from the untamed forest to the highest social elite, and the heroes are the only ones who can expose the villains.

"A Flirtation with Fey" also contains an eight-page gazetteer of Thaven, the setting for this adventure and a vibrant town suitable for use in any game world.

"A Flirtation with Fey" is an urban adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Presented for PCs of 3rd or 4th level, this adventure also contains notes and statistics for scaling challenges to PCs of higher or lower level. The adventure features numerous player handouts and clues, pregenerated characters, an urban gazetteer, and a file containing 1-inch square maps of all encounter areas ready for printing. "A Flirtation with Fey" is written by Gregory Hanigan and Ron Lundeen, with art and maps by Marco Morte, Jeff Strand, Blake Wilkie, Richard Chaplin, Maciej Zagorski, and Tamas Baranya.

170968.name: Dangan Ronpa 1･2  Chou Koukou Kyuu No Jinrou
boardgameexpansion: Dangan Ronpa Chou Koukyuu No Jinrou Maniax
170968.description:
This is somewhat similar to a Werewolf game, with the setting of Danganronpa series.

The players are largely divided into two teams, Hope Side and Despair Side, by their assigned Role Cards. Each player also has a unique Character card and starts with two Item cards, both of which can be used to change the flow of the gamw.

There is a total of 126 cards in the game.

35 of them are Character Cards featuring characters from both Dangan Ronpa and Dangan Ronpa 2, there are also 7 types of Role Cards (19 cards total),
1. Alter Ego (Hope): Select 1 person each night, and you will be told if the person is Hope Side or Despair Side. Reveal your Role Card when you are killed. You win if the Blackened dies. (1 card)
2. White (Hope): Similar to villager, no special characteristics. You win if the Blackened dies. (10 cards)
3. Despair Disease Patient (Hope): Appears to others as being on Despair Side despite being on Hope Side. (1 card)
4. Monomi (Hope): Select 1 player to guard each night. If the Blackened targets the same player, you die in an explosion and they live on (effect similar to "Knight" role). You appear to be on Despair Side despite being on Hope Side. You win if the Blackened dies. (1 card)
5. Traitor (Despair): Can see who the Blackened (and other Traitors) are on the first night but the Blackened doesn't know who they are. They win if the Blackened wins. (1 card)
6. Blackened (Despair): Select 1 player each night to attack (like a Werewolf). Reveal your role card when you are killed. You win if you commit a set number of murders and then survive until the next night. (1 card)
7. Ultimate Despair (Despair?): Appears to be on Hope Side until somebody dies and appears to be on Despair Side thereafter. This role has a solo victory objective to be punished during the Class Trial. (1 card)
19 types of item cards (49 total), 2 target cards (for use by black to indicate who to kill off) 16 Summary cards (explaining the game)
3 blank character cards, 1 blank role card and 1 blank item card for your own creations.
Inside would also contain a rule book explaining all the different modes and explanation of all the characters.
There is also a template for you to record down your plays for the gamemasters usage.

boardgamehonor: 2015 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Enfant Winner
2015 As d'Or - Jeu de l'Année Nominee
170969.description:
La chasse aux Gigamons is a game for 2 to 4 players from 5 years old.

This is the last event to enter the guild of magicians. It remains the ultimate lesson to master: the invocation of Gigamons. After this test, one that will catch more Gigamons be promoted to Elemage. Good luck and good luck to all!

Aim of the game
Find the pairs Elemons to the exchange against Gigamons.

Setting up of the game:

1-Mix all the Elemons tiles face down and create a 3 by 3 square!
2-Place the 7 Gigamons and the Rocks tiles on the side of the play area.
3-The remaining Tiles of Elemons form the deck.

How to play?

The youngest begins.
In turn, each player returns 2 face tiles.
If the tiles are different, the player puts the face down (Polymon always forms a pair with any elemon)
If the tiles are identical, the player wins and triggers the power the Elemon that is drawn (see specials ability of each Elemons. Then he replaces them 2 tiles from the deck without looking at them.





If a player has 3 identical Elemons, it can put them back in the box to catch the Gigamon associate. If an opponent already has this Gigamon, he can steal it.
Then it was the turn of the next player.

Elemon powers:


Polymon: Functions as a wild, always forming a pair with any elemon.
Floramon: The player takes a tile from the top of the draw pile and adds it to their group of tiles.
Aeromon: Swap one of the tiles in front of you with a tile in front of another player. The player who gets the ability gets to choose which tiles are swapped.
Pyromon: Choose a tile in front of another player and remove it from the game.
Hydromon: While everyone else closes their eyes, look at four of the tiles in the 3X3 grid and then turn them back over.
Geomon: Place a rock tile on one of the tiles in the 3X3 grid. No player may pick up the tile underneath the rock until the player who played it takes their next turn.
Electromon: The player gets an extra turn.


End of the game
The game ends in 2 ways:

When a player has caught 3 Gigamons;
When the Elemons tiles deck is empty.




Who win the game?

Who ever has the most Gigamons is promoted to Elemage!
In case of tie, who ever has the most Elemons wins.
In case of a tie, all tied players are promoted to Elemages.
170969.name: La chasse aux Gigamons

170970.name: Mantles of Power
170970.description:
From publisher blurb:

Call to Arms is a book line for players and gamemasters alike. Each book focuses on a different type of item, expanding rules for those items and adding everything from new mundane and magical examples of the item to new character options related to the item. While Call to Arms: Mantles of Power includes mantles that are merely made of cloth, the real focus of this book is to introduce new mechanics for mundane mantles of authority and mystical mantles of power, imbuing characters with in-game benefits.

Whether it would be taking on the title of “Town Guard” to becoming the “Hero of Light”, various boons, responsibilities, and abilities come with these titles. And of course there is the usual review and expansion of mundane, magical, cursed, mythic, and artifact mantles.

170971.name: Trailer Park Boys: Supply & Command
170971.description:
From the publisher's website:

Straight out of the Trailer Park! High Roller Games brings you the Ultimate Party Game - Supply and Command! Like the classic Asshole or President game, Supply and Command lets you take charge as the new park Supervisor. But watch out, it's Survival of the Fitness, where new rules and new dicks can lead to some awkwardly situations. With original pics of the TPB characters, its the perfect game for those smokey cheeseburger liquor parties. Guaranteed to make your night extra greasy! *This game is supported by the People’s Freedom of Choices and Voices Act.

The deck contains cards ranked from 12 to 1, along with two Jokers, Cory and Trevor. Each card bears a number, which is not only its rank, but also tells you how many of that card exist in the deck. The lower the number, the better the rank.

The deck is dealt out to all players and the object is to get rid of your cards as fast as possible. The hand begins with one person playing one or more card to the center of the table. The cards played must all be of the same rank (although Jokers are wild, and may be played with any other cards). Each player in turn must now either play the same number of cards of a better rank, or pass. Play continues around the table until everyone has passed; at that point, the cards are cleared and whoever played the last set of cards leads the next round. After everyone has gone out, the players are ranked. The person who first got rid of all his cards becomes the Trailer Park Supervisor. The last becomes the Shit Puppet. Players change seat position to represent the new hierarchy and begin another round.

TPB: Supply and Command also includes two optional decks, Supervisor and Trailer Park. These cards are used to provide additional advantages to the Supervisor or to make the Shit Puppets' life more miserable.

170972.name: Lords of the Fallen 2
170972.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game is announced but has not been released yet and is NOT sold yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it, nor add new releases.




User Summary

Lords of the Fallen 2 will be a follow up to the first game.

170973.name: Appalachian Trail Game
170973.description: Create your own adventure on the Appalachian Trail as you hike your way along the nearly 2,200 mile footpath. Collect points as you correctly answer trivia questions, identify plants and animals, and use the gear in your pack to help navigate through perilous situations that arise! The games ends when the first player completes a Thru Hike--arriving at either Katahdin or Springer Mountain. All players then tally the points from their Trail Journal cards and the player with the most points is the winner!

170974.name: Bladestorm: Nightmare
170974.description:
User Summary

Bladestorm: Nightmare is a revamp and sequel to Bladestorm: The Hundred Years' War. Graphics will not be given a dramatic visual upgrade. The game is split into two halves: Hundred Years' War and Nightmare. Hundred Years' War offers a similar experience to the original title. Nightmare is a fantasy story that includes wizards and dragons in make-believe battles.

170975.name: Dragon Fin Soup
170975.description:
The game takes place on Asura, a world situated on the back of an enormous dragon-turtle. The story follows Red Robin, an alcoholic yet cheerful mercenary. The Story mode for the game follows a line of quests which reveal the game's lore. The game uses elements from fairy tales including Robin Hood and Little Red Riding Hood.

It is influenced by roguelike games and uses procedural generation for parts of the game. The game has two modes: Story mode follows a story and is more like a typical RPG, while Survival mode skips the story and focuses on the surviving within the game and constrains players with permadeath—once the player character dies, the game must be restarted from the beginning.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dragon Fin Soup", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

170976.name: Dunsany's Chess
170976.description:
Developed by Irish author Lord Dunsany in 1942, this is an asymmetric variant of chess. One side has a standard chess army, while the other only has a horde of 32 pawns. The side with a full army goes first, and wins by capturing all opposing pawns. The side with only pawns cannot give them an initial double moves, but can promote them as normal, and wins by checkmating the king.

In addition to offering a unique puzzle, it is good for teaching chess, since one player can observe the moves of the pieces while needing only to remember how to make pawn moves.

170977.name: Dungeon Escape Micro Edition: The Classic Game of Memory
boardgameimplementation: Dungeon Escape: A classic game of memory with a twist!
170977.description:
From the designer KS page:
Micro version of the card game that plays like the game of memory with a fantasy twist, adding heroes, battles, equipment, and more. The micro edition of Dungeon Escape is a fast paced game of memory for 2 players, taking no more than 5 minutes per game and perfect for ages 5 to adult.

170978.name: Into Blue Valley
170978.description:
Into Blue Valley is a first-person exploration game drawing upon themes of mystery and curiosity. It is presented as a ‘found footage’ game with the player’s view resembling a camcorder recording showing a glimpse into the subdued environment that is being explored.

As the footage unfolds, it soon becomes clear that the bittersweet majesty of Blue Valley offers more than a forgotten tale of abandonment and that the person recording this footage is not alone in their journey.

Source: The Publisher Website.

170979.name: Nameless
170979.description:
"Eri"(The name is replacable) is a high school student and everything about her seems ordinary except she has a special hobby.

With her parents living overseas, she was left all alone after her grandpa's death.

Eri is into collecting ball-jointed dolls made from the doll company, Crobidoll. Although she treats her dolls like her real family, she cannot talk about them to even her "normal" best friends. She started to rely on her dolls to escape from her loneliness. Then, one day, she had a dream about feathers coming out of her diary and when she woke up, she heard strange sounds coming from her kitchen...

Source: The Game Website.

170980.name: Elven Castle
170980.description:
At the beginning of the Эльфийский Замок (Elven Castle) each player recieves a set of arches of one color. Game takes place on plastic board which has 31 pin groupped in hexagon shape. On his turn player must place an arch on pins. Arch may be placed only on board or on two another arches. After placing an arch player gains victory points based on arch heights above ground or above the arch directly below newly placed arch. Game ends when one player can't place arch or runs out of arches. Victory points substracted for each arch left in reserve and for each arch placed directly on the board and not connected to other arches.

Game comes with set of scenarios which may add new rules for gaining victory points, and add starting black neutral arches to the board.

170981.name: Ukranian Ninja
170981.description:
Jump, dash, hack, and slash your way through many environments as you eliminate your enemies. Use your fist, shurikens , AK , and sword to dispatch invaders. Explore worlds such as the ruined city, a moving military transport train, and the front lines while getting ready to fight multiple bosses that wont stop shooting at you. Gain extra coins in our Bonus Rounds to help you buy goodies at the equipment shop. Get ready for the next phase in platform gaming, bring back the oldschool and combining it with the new. Lets get our Ninja on!

Source: The Publisher Website.

170982.name: One Late Night
170982.description:
One Late Night is a short immersive horror-game experience, starring an unnamed graphic designer employee, working late one night at the office, until strange things start to happen.

The basic idea is that players who have been in similar situations, and worked with similar office jobs, will relate themselves to the game setting and scenario and become immersed. Even if you can't relate to the game storyline, you will still get a good experience. The storyline is presented with short monologues, displaying the thoughts of the player, as you need to perform certain tasks to proceed in the game to continue discover new clues about what's going on.

Source: The Game Website.

170983.name: One late night: Deadline
170983.description:
One Late Night: Deadline continues the story of One Late Night, a horror/mystery game where you play the role of an office worker caught in the middle of the paranormal activity that has broken out in a seemingly ordinary office building. Freely explore the 5 story office complex that houses several different companies. Look for clues around the offices, read newspapers about local events, hack your colleagues emails – anything that might tell you something related to the strange happenings.

You arrive at your work late in the night. The rain is pouring down and a storm is closing in fast. Everyone has gone home for the day a long time ago, but the lights in the lobby are still on as usual. As you enter the office complex through the main entrance, you immediately feel the emptiness and begin to go over in your head "what the hell you are doing here in the middle of the night?", when you could be at home getting some well-deserved sleep. However, while your mind is clouded with the details of your precious deadline, you are unaware of lurking danger in the building and what has occurred during the night. Something has been set free; something that's not from the world of the living. The shadowy and long hallways beckon you as you attempt to unravel the mystery that has befallen the unassuming offices. Has everyone really gone home, or is someone or something still here?

Source: The Game Website.
